Phrase en Anglais: And just who does he think's putting food on the table while he's off taking naps in that little hole of his!?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Ha ! C'est risible !
Et qui croyez-vous qui met de la nourriture sur la table pendant qu'il fait la sieste dans son petit trou ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Hmm... I was going to give this present to my husband, since he needed some cheering up lately, but...${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous l'avez acheté, n'est-ce pas ?

Phrase en Anglais: Since you did his chores for him, it's yours.
Phrase en Français: Hmm... J'allais offrir ce cadeau à mon mari, car il avait besoin de se remonter le moral ces derniers temps, mais...${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Well, he always wanted to be an adventurer himself, so he should be happy knowing you have it.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Puisque vous avez fait ses corvées à sa place, c'est à vous.

Phrase en Anglais: Ah, did you find my husband? Good.
Phrase en Français: Eh bien, il a toujours voulu être aventurier lui-même, alors il devrait être heureux de savoir que vous l'avez.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I keep telling him to check his pockets before he leaves, but he never does.
Phrase en Français: Ah, vous avez trouvé mon mari ? Bien.

Phrase en Anglais: Anyway, here, take this. For your trouble.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je lui dis toujours de vérifier ses poches avant de partir, mais il ne le fait jamais.

Phrase en Anglais: My husband used to listen to me a lot more when we were young.
Phrase en Français: Quoi qu'il en soit, tenez, prenez ça. Pour vous dédommager.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: It'd be funny if he was going through a rebellious phase at his age!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Mon mari m'écoutait beaucoup plus quand nous étions jeunes.
Ce serait drôle s'il traversait une phase rebelle à son âge !${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Oh, you think because I'm just a kid you can walk over and talk to me for no good reason?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Que veux-tu ?

Phrase en Anglais: True, I might look like a child now, but I know I was once a great warrior, and I can prove it.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Oh, tu crois que parce que je suis juste un gamin, tu peux venir me parler pour rien ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Do you want to see proof?
Phrase en Français: C'est vrai, je peux avoir l'air d'un enfant maintenant, mais je sais que j'étais autrefois un grand guerrier, et je peux le prouver.${prompt}
Tu veux voir la preuve ?

Phrase en Anglais: I wasn't going to show you anyway.
I know your type. Patting kids on the head and thinking how great life was when you were their age, right? Spare me, please.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je ne comptais de toute façon pas vous le montrer.
Je connais votre genre. Tapoter les enfants sur la tête et penser à quel point c'était génial la vie quand vous étiez à leur âge, n'est-ce pas ? Épargnez-moi, s'il vous plaît.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Well...all right, here. But be careful!
Phrase en Français: Je le pensais.

Phrase en Anglais: It's very, very valuable--it's a piece of my past life.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Bon... d'accord, tenez. Mais faites attention !

Phrase en Anglais: A friend gave this to me over twenty years ago.
Phrase en Français: C'est très, très précieux - c'est un morceau de ma vie passée.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I can't remember what it all means, though.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Un ami me l'a donné il y a plus de vingt ans.

Phrase en Anglais: I showed this to my friend Gumbah once, and his opinion was that this is a very valuable document that tells you each monster type's weakness.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je ne me souviens pas de ce que tout cela signifie, cependant.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: He said it will come in handy when I become an adventurer.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: J'ai montré cela à mon ami Gumbah une fois, et son avis était que c'est un document très précieux qui vous indique les faiblesses de chaque type de monstre.${prompt}
Il a dit que ça serait utile quand je deviendrai aventurier.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Come back anytime if you want to see it again.
Phrase en Français: Tu as été un bon élève.

Phrase en Anglais: Well, at least until I leave on my first adventure...${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Reviens quand tu veux si tu veux le revoir.
Enfin, au moins jusqu'à ce que je parte pour ma première aventure...${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You can't fish without a rod in your hands.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous ne pouvez pas pêcher ici.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You can't fish without bait on the hook.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous ne pouvez pas pêcher sans une canne à la main.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You can't fish at the moment.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous ne pouvez pas pêcher sans appât à l'hameçon.${prompt}
Vous ne pouvez pas pêcher pour le moment.${prompt}
Vous n'avez rien attrapé.${prompt}
${entity: 0} a attrapé un monstre!${prompt}
Votre ligne se casse.${prompt}
Votre canne se casse.${prompt}
Quelque chose a accroché l'hameçon!${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: ${entity: 0} caught ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, but cannot carry any more items.
Phrase en Français: Vous avez perdu votre prise.${prompt}
${entity: 0} a attrapé ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, mais ne peut pas porter plus d'objets.
${entity: 0} relâche avec regret le ${item-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Vous sentez qu'il y a quelque chose ici.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You dig up ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, but your inventory is full.
Phrase en Français: Vous sentez qu'il y a quelque chose à proximité.${prompt}
Vous déterrez ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, mais votre inventaire est plein.
Vous jetez avec regret le ${item-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You dig and you dig, but find nothing.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: ${entity: 0} a attrapé ${item-count: 1[2]} ${item-given-plurality: 1[2], 0[2]}!${prompt}
Vous creusez et creusez, mais ne trouvez rien.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Votre canne se casse.
Ce qui a accroché l'hameçon était assez gros.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Votre canne se casse.
Ce qui a accroché l'hameçon était trop lourd pour être attrapé avec cette canne.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Whatever caught the hook was too small to catch with this rod.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous avez perdu votre prise.

Phrase en Anglais: You lost your catch due to your lack of skill.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Ce qui a accroché l'hameçon était trop petit pour être attrapé avec cette canne.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Auction houses can be found in all of Vana'diel's major cities. Here adventurers gather to bid on battle spoils, unwanted items, old armor...almost anything.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Rien pour le moment.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Currently, the auction houses in Bastok, San d'Oria, Windurst, and Jeuno all work independently. Therefore, prices differ from city to city.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: On trouve des maisons des enchères dans toutes les grandes villes de Vana'diel. C'est là que les aventuriers se réunissent pour enchérir sur des butins de bataille, des objets non désirés, de vieux armures... presque tout.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Adventurers may use any auction house regardless of nationality.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Actuellement, les maisons des enchères à Bastok, San d'Oria, Windurst et Jeuno fonctionnent toutes de manière indépendante. Par conséquent, les prix diffèrent d'une ville à l'autre.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: The first adventurer to bid at or above the asking price will automatically purchase the product.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Les aventuriers peuvent utiliser n'importe quelle maison des enchères, quel que soit leur nationalité.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Once put up for auction, merchandise will remain there for a maximum of thirty weeks Vana'diel time (nine-and-a-half days Earth time).${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Le premier aventurier à enchérir au prix demandé ou plus achètera automatiquement le produit.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: If merchandise does not sell within this time limit, it will be returned to the seller's current residence.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Une fois mis aux enchères, un article restera là pendant un maximum de trente semaines en temps de Vana'diel (neuf jours et demi en temps terrestre).${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Transaction fees are proportional to the amount for which an item is put up on auction. The method of calculating this fee is different for single items and stackable items.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Si un article ne se vend pas dans ce délai, il sera renvoyé à la résidence actuelle du vendeur.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: A transaction fee is collected when any merchandise is put up for auction. This fee is nonrefundable.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Les frais de transaction sont proportionnels au montant pour lequel un article est mis aux enchères. La méthode de calcul de ces frais est différente pour les articles uniques et les articles empilables.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: The International Auction House Committee, or IAHC, has declared that a maximum of seven items may be put up for auction at one time.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Des frais de transaction sont perçus lorsque toute marchandise est mise aux enchères. Ces frais ne sont pas remboursables.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: However, the IAHC has recently removed the limit to how many items one may purchase.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Le Comité international des maisons des enchères, ou CIHE, a déclaré qu'un maximum de sept articles pouvaient être mis aux enchères à la fois.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: A small amount of time is required before new merchandise appears on our bid list.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Cependant, le CIHE a récemment supprimé la limite au nombre d'articles pouvant être achetés.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Once an item appears on your “Sales Status” list, it may not immediately appear on the bid list. If you do not see your item on the bid list, try looking again at a later time.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Un petit laps de temps est nécessaire avant que de nouveaux articles n'apparaissent sur notre liste d'enchères.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: If you would like to withdraw an item from an auction, you must travel to the auction house, and select “Stop Sale” from the “Sales Status” menu.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Une fois qu'un article apparaît dans votre liste "État des ventes", il peut ne pas apparaître immédiatement dans la liste d'enchères. Si vous ne voyez pas votre article dans la liste d'enchères, essayez de regarder à nouveau plus tard.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: To remove an item from your “Sales Status” list, you must visit an auction counter to acknowledge the sale or return of your merchandise.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Si vous souhaitez retirer un article d'une enchère, vous devez vous rendre à la maison des enchères et sélectionner "Arrêter la vente" dans le menu "État des ventes".${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Otherwise, previously sold or returned items will fill up your list and prevent you from selling any more merchandise.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Pour retirer un article de votre liste "État des ventes", vous devez vous rendre à un comptoir d'enchères pour reconnaître la vente ou le retour de votre marchandise.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: At any auction counter, open the “Sales Status” menu and acknowledge the transaction to clear it from the list.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Sinon, les articles déjà vendus ou retournés rempliront votre liste et vous empêcheront de vendre d'autres marchandises.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Press the confirm button to remove any transaction colored yellow (sold) or red (returned).${prompt}
Phrase en Français: À n'importe quel comptoir d'enchères, ouvrez le menu "État des ventes" et reconnaissez la transaction pour la supprimer de la liste.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Is there anything else you would like to know?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Appuyez sur le bouton de confirmation pour supprimer toute transaction colorée en jaune (vendue) ou en rouge (retournée).${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: In the past, many have amassed great wealth through the auction house. I hope you find fortune, too!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Y a-t-il autre chose que vous aimeriez savoir ?${prompt}
Dans le passé, beaucoup ont amassé une grande richesse grâce à la maison des enchères. J'espère que vous trouverez aussi fortune !${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I'll be back in a few days, kupo!${prompt}
I'm back from my vacation, kupo!${prompt}
Here's your present--the behemoth of Mog Safes, kupo! Now you can store as many as 70 items, kupo!${prompt}
The capacity of your Mog Safe has increased!${prompt}
I have a favor to ask, kupo!${prompt}
After resting on the ${item-singular: 3[2]}, I noticed a letter had arrived from some old moogle friends, kupo! Will my magnanimous master give me some time off to go visit my old buddies?${prompt}
Give your moogle some time off?
No, I am your only friend now!${prompt}
My moogle friends live across the seas, so I have another favor to ask you, kupo!${prompt}
The sun beats down mercilessly in the land beyond the west sea, so I need to take ${article} ${item-article: 5[2]} for my friends there, kupo!${prompt}
And my other buddies need ${article} ${item-article: 6[2]} for the torrential rains that scour the lands across the east sea, kupo!${prompt}
I can't help out my friends if I don't have ${article} ${item-article: 5[2]} and ${article} ${item-article: 6[2]}, kupo...${prompt}
I'll be sure to bring you a souvenir from my overseas trip, kupo! See you in a few days, master!${prompt}
I'm back from visiting my old moogle friends, kupo!${prompt}
We all got together and made you a new Mog Safe, kupo! Now you can store as many as 80 items, kupo!${prompt}
I am Virnage, a friar, from the San d'Oria Cathedral.
Coming to Bastok is part of my pilgrimage.${prompt}
I was to return to San d'Oria after praying at the Crag of Dem...${prompt}
But I've seen something horrible here that demanded that I stay.
The statue of the Goddess in the Metalworks--yes, its placement is deplorable, too--its paint is peeling off!${prompt}
I cannot believe that no one here noticed! That statue's paint is specifically made to endure the rigors of time! It is supposed to last dozens of years!${prompt}
Ah, but there is hope. I once read an account of friars carrying off a batch of paint with them as they sought a place of safety during the Great War!${prompt}
They stayed in a citadel on the Sauromugue Champaign. The paint may be there still!
I have heard people here say you are a great adventurer. Please, help the Goddess in Her hour of need!${prompt}
Please, the Goddess needs your help!${prompt}
May the Goddess bless your soul!${prompt}
I would like to repay you for your deeds, but I have nothing to give you at the moment.${prompt}
Here, I will give you this letter. Bring it to Eperdur in the San d'Oria Cathedral. I am sure he will give you a reward.${prompt}
May the Gates of Paradise open for you.${prompt}
Hand my letter to Eperdur in the San d'Oria Cathedral to claim your reward.${prompt}
The Goddess's image has been restored!
Yet...I've received word from the cathedral that my pilgrimage is not yet complete.${prompt}
The Gates of Paradise are very far, indeed...${prompt}
You look as if you've been working hard.${prompt}
I can see that you've become quite the adventurer. When you get to be my age, you can tell these things, you know.${prompt}
My darling son, may his soul rest in peace, was a warrior, and so was my grandson...until he decided to quit and become a doorman.${prompt}
My son didn't teach him how to wield a sword so he could go waste his skill on being a doorman.
He didn't even take his father's sword with him.${prompt}
Sure, it may be a little old and may need a few repairs.
I think that the handle requires some kind of special part...${prompt}
I remember my son saying he had found ${keyitem-article: 7[2]} in a tent when he and some great Galka named Ragarimin, or something like that, went on an expedition to the Orcs' stronghold.${prompt}
If you happen to stop by there on your way somewhere, picking some up would make me ever so grateful.${prompt}
Well I'll be! You've brought me ${keyitem-article: 7[2]}!
I'll ask my sweetie in the Blacksmiths' Guild to fix it all up, good as new.${prompt}
I'm sorry. I have no way to repay you now.
Could you please come back tomorrow?${prompt}
Thanks to you, my son's sword is as good as it was the day it was forged.
I'm sorry to bother you any further, but could you take this to my grandson?${prompt}
To get to where he's stationed, I hear you have to ride this newfangled elevatie contraption.${prompt}
They say that doormen get decent pay, so you can get your reward from my grandson. I'm sure he won't mind.${prompt}
So, you took the sword to my grandson? Hmm...and the sword was connected to that Sir Ragimorimm character?${prompt}
Now that you mention it, when Sir Ragamuffimm was a young'un, he was always acting all grown-up. Why do you suppose that is..?${prompt}
All those Galka praising the likes of him... Except for one. There was one who hated that Sir Ragamamm.${prompt}
Yes, I remember my son having a bit of trouble with that fellow.
I think his name was Deidogolly, or something like that.${prompt}
What do you think you're looking at?
Huh? Deidogolly? What did that old Phara woman say?
That nonsense has nothing to do with me.${prompt}
I don't know anything about any pesky old Hume woman. Raogrimm and Yasin? Yeah, I knew them. Raogrimm and I were the same age, too. ${prompt}
Sure, when he was reborn the same year as I was, he had two hundred years of knowledge.${prompt}
Raogrimm the know-it-all, acting like an elder when he was just a kid... Always adored by everyone...${prompt}
And on top of that, becoming a Musketeer to win the favor of the Humes--how low can you get!?
I even heard rumors that he was having relations with one of their females.${prompt}
Yeah, yeah. I heard the story about him taking down some mighty Quadav in the Palborough Mines, but I don't believe it.${prompt}
He was told to bring back a certain item as proof, but you know, he never did.${prompt}
“The beast did not carry one.” That's what he said, but it's a lie. A lie he told to gain fame. I bet you he never went anywhere near the beast's lair.${prompt}
You seem strong enough. Why don't you go and see if you can take down that Quadav? They say it appears deep in the Palborough Mines in some room where the Quadav keep their eggs.${prompt}
If you can bring back ${article} ${item-article: 7[2]}, then it will prove that Raogrimm was a fake!${prompt}
This proves it! Raogrimm was a liar!${prompt}
“Talekeeper”... Hah! He was nothing but a fake!${prompt}
If it isn't Pagdako...I mean, “Iron Eater.”
What, the Humes finally let you off your leash?${prompt}
I have some business in this area, but that is of no importance.
I hear that you have been speaking ill of Sir Raogrimm again.${prompt}
Yeah...yeah, I have. And why not? Raogrimm lied about killing that Quadav just to gain fame.${prompt}
Ah, I see. You are still going on about that...${prompt}
Sir Raogrimm fought the beastmen for the good of his countrymen.
He would never steal trophies for his own profit or fame.${prompt}
The order was for him to take down the Quadav, not to retrieve the item.${prompt}
And, I have also heard that Sir Raogrimm himself questioned many of his orders, finding them at odds with his moral beliefs.${prompt}
What does that have to do with anything!?${prompt}
But there was one time, and one time only, when Sir Raogrimm took an item from a monster.${prompt}
He needed it to finish a new pair of greaves he had promised to a friend.${prompt}
He traveled to Castle Oztroja to obtain a rare ${item-singular: 6[2]} from the leeches there...
It was with this item that he completed his friend's greaves.${prompt}
That friend would always talk ill of him, but was the only one who would treat him as an equal.${prompt}
I can't... Why would he... There is no way he could go all the way to Oztroja...a-and I've never heard of such an item anyway.${prompt}
So you really do get these from the leeches in Castle Oztroja... He went all the way there to keep his promise...${prompt}
Yes, I do have greaves made of this material. They were sent to me with an unsigned note that only said, “The greaves I promised.”${prompt}
My apologies. The ceremonial outfits adults give me are too cumbersome--especially these shoes.${prompt}
Whatever. It sounds to me like you're just spoiled.
You're the Talekeeper, right? You should be able to choose your own shoes.${prompt}
But I can't just ignore their good will.${prompt}
Oh, come on! Here, you can have these. They're pretty light.
Don't worry, I got two pairs the other day.${prompt}
You, the boy who can get anything he wants? I don't need any of that junk.
When you get strong enough to go out on your own, you can get me something a hundred times better than the shoes I just gave you.${prompt}
It must have been that promise...
Why would he remember something stupid like that?
Even I didn't remember until now...${prompt}
Anyway, I thank you. Those greaves are old now, but I can repair them with this new ${item-singular: 7[2]}.${prompt}
My days of battle are over. I would like you to have the greaves. Stop by tomorrow morning to pick them up.${prompt}
These hold the soul of Raogrimm. Use them as he would have.${prompt}
I hate saying this to an outsider like you, but...thanks. And that's all I'm going to say.${prompt}
Hey, remember when Iron Eater showed up here?${prompt}
He was gathering information about Raogrimm. I hear that they are starting up some operation to collect his lost items...${prompt}
And so I got this idea...${prompt}
...Wait. I can't be asking outsiders for help. It's just not like me. Forget what I said!${prompt}
You don't look so good, Gwill.
You're not being teased by those Hume kids again, are you?${prompt}
Why do you let those creeps push you around like that?
With your strength, you could teach them a lesson.${prompt}
If you won't do it, I could always...${prompt}
It's just that Arawn and Emrys don't understand...${prompt}
What do you mean, don't understand?${prompt}
Detzo, do you think that ${item-plural: 7[2]} taste good?${prompt}
Well, I've never tried one anyway, so I wouldn't know. But from what I hear, they're supposed to taste pretty good.${prompt}
I guess I'd have to try one to really find out.${prompt}
Well, the thing is, I have tried one before. Dalzakk brought some back from his adventures once.
When I told this to Arawn and Emrys, they said that there was no way that a cookie with ginger in it could be that delicious.${prompt}
That's so stupid... They're stupid for saying something like that, and you are just as stupid for getting all upset over it.${prompt}
If you can't stick up for yourself over something like that, then you shouldn't talk to those guys anymore.
Just stay home and read books like you always do, you pitiful excuse for a Galka!${prompt}
You know, I think I heard somebody talking about ${item-plural: 7[2]}...${prompt}
Yeah, I remember now. Deidogg said that he used to eat them with his friend a long time ago.${prompt}
...I see Detzo has a big mouth.
Yeah, this brings back memories. Raogrimm and I always used to eat these.${prompt}
That's right. You're the one who wanted to hear about the operation to find some of Raogrimm's lost items.${prompt}
Many years ago, Raogrimm was sent as an envoy to San d'Oria. As a gesture of friendship, he offered his armor to the Knights of San d'Oria.${prompt}
But apparently it was recently stolen. To San d'Oria, this is an enormous blunder, and the high-ups in Bastok are determined to get it back first.${prompt}
Bastok wants to use the armor as a bargaining tool with San d'Oria.
Unbelievable what outrageous plans those Humes think up...${prompt}
Hey, why don't you try to find it before the Musketeers do? I'd rather an adventurer like you have that armor than seeing it turned into a political tool for those idiots in the government.${prompt}
I heard that the ones who stole Raogrimm's armor are a group of Goblin thieves that keep their hideout in the Behemoth's Dominion.${prompt}
Vana'diel is abuzz with “Adventurer Appreciation” fever, kupo!${prompt}
We moogles have prepared some nice little goodies and gathered lots of top-secret information on adventurer activity, kupo!
Let me check my journal for your statistical data...${prompt}
There's your adventuring life in a nutshell!${prompt}
There's your adventuring life in a nutshell!

And this time, there's an extra-special anniversary present involved! Oh, just be careful you don't accidentally throw it away or anything, because you'll never be able to get another one...ever, kupo!${prompt}
Take a look--and to think, you can select ${number: 0} more amazing anniversary items!${prompt}
Take a look--and to think, you can select ${number: 0} more amazing anniversary item!${prompt}
Ah, I understand. With some many goodies to choose from, it's no surprise that you'd want to think about it a bit more. I'll be here once you've decided, kupo.${prompt}
An excellent choice! I hope you enjoy your brand-new ${item-singular: 9[2]}!${prompt}
There's your adventuring life in a nutshell!
And because it seems you're so eager to get your hands on some more goodies, I guess I could find it in my heart to spare another...but just for you, kupo!${prompt}
You have the choice to either receive your present now, or “wait” to build up the suspense, kupo!${prompt}
If you choose to wait, you might find yourself receiving an even better present, kupo.${prompt}
Take all the time you need, and talk to me when you're ready, kupo!${prompt}
Let's see how long you can wait before the suspense finally gets to you, kupo!${prompt}
Good luck, ${choice: 0}[citizen/comrade]. I will bestow upon you your nation's Signet.${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
I cannot help you. You should go find a guard from your own country.${prompt}
I cannot accept crystals from someone whose rank is still 1.
I advise you to either keep them until your reach rank 2, or to use them in craftwork.${prompt}
Since we are allied with San d'Oria...${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
Since we are allied with Bastok...${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
Since we are allied with Windurst...${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}

Ah, you have brought us supplies. These will help us indeed. I thank you.${prompt}
Hmm... These supplies you have brought us are too old to be of any use. We will dispose of them promptly.
I do commend you for your effort. May you succeed next time.${prompt}
You are now taking part in your nation's conquest campaign!${prompt}
I am one of the guards charged with overseeing San d'Oria's conquest campaign.${prompt}
I am one of the guards charged with overseeing Bastok's conquest campaign.${prompt}
I am one of the guards charged with overseeing Windurst's conquest campaign.${prompt}

All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call “conquests.” You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.${prompt}
Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.${prompt}
Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.${prompt}
So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.${prompt}
Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control.
They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.${prompt}
Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.${prompt}

Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.${prompt}
So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike.
We expect you to do your best to serve your country.${prompt}
You can see the current state of conquests by selecting “Region Info” from the main menu.
Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.${prompt}
Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank.
The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.${prompt}
You can donate crystals to your nation once you achieve rank 2.
Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.${prompt}
We would like you to donate crystals to your nation from now on.
Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.${prompt}
You can acquire crystals by defeating enemies while you have your nation's Signet.
Having Signet cast on you is also the only way of taking part in conquests.${prompt}
Rank points will be awarded to you for each crystal you donate, and you may be offered new missions as your rank goes up.${prompt}
You also receive rank points for completing missions.
Complete missions and take part in conquests to raise your rank and serve your country.${prompt}
You are awarded conquest points when you defeat monsters while you are taking part in conquests.
Select "Region Info" from the menu to check your current number of conquest points.${prompt}
You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.${prompt}

When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.${prompt}
If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.${prompt}
Merchants will also be placed there, and goods from that region will find their way to the local shops here.${prompt}
Gaining control of regions is the basic principle behind conquests. We need each of you to do your best, and bring our nation to the top of the ranks.${prompt}
Of course, sometimes we lose regions to other nations...so we must try to take them back before the next conquest results are announced.${prompt}
As an incentive, we will award you with more conquest points for defeating monsters in those regions.${prompt}

But if we are allied with another nation, you will only be awarded the regular rate for defeating monsters in our allies' regions. On the other hand, we will award you with more points for fighting in the top-ranked nation's regions.${prompt}
Our paramount concern lies in the beastmen gaining control of our regions.
If too many of us are defeated in a region, the beastmen will gain control of it.${prompt}
If this happens, not only is it a great blow to our pride, but you will be unable to acquire any crystals in that region.${prompt}
The beastmen are a menace to all nations. If they rise to power, we must all unite and drive those vile creatures from that region.${prompt}
We need you to bring supplies to the outpost border guards who are placed in regions under our control.${prompt}
There is one outpost in each region. Select “Region Info” from the menu, and look for the areas with a small flag mark on the map. That is where they are.${prompt}
Here are the supplies. Just give them to the guard at the outpost and your mission will be complete.
Now, choose which outpost you want to go to. We give different rewards for each region, so choose carefully.${prompt}

You have until the next conquest results announcement to complete this mission.

You can only undertake one supply mission per day.

It is possible to fully recharge ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]} by trading it to one of your nation's guards, including outpost guards. One charge requires 100 conquest points.${prompt}
It is possible to fully recharge ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]} by trading it to one of your nation's guards, including outpost guards. One charge requires 200 conquest points.${prompt}

Very soon I will be drawn into that soul. I no longer have the strength to resist. The soul that was divided will become whole once more, and that rage will take on physical form.${prompt}

A new Shadow Lord will be born. Surely you have sensed the growing evil? The beastman armies that are imprisoned here are massing for battle. They plan a return to the world of their origin, the realm that exists beneath the light of hope.${prompt}
My link to you will soon be severed, so listen carefully.

Thirty years ago, an expeditionary squad formed from the elite soldiers of each nation was sent to investigate the Northlands. You must have seen their memories when you first laid your hand upon the chunks of magicite.${prompt}
Seek out the markings that the expedition members left behind. They will aid you in gaining entrance to this world.
You must defeat the Shadow Lord before our unification is complete.
There is an unusual arrangement of branches here.${prompt}
There is an unusual arrangement of pebbles here.${prompt}
The strands of grass here have been tied together.${prompt}
There is an unusual arrangement of leaves on the ground.${prompt}
I see you have met with Raogrimm.
His soul is no longer confined to that incarnation of rage, the Shadow Lord, yet the fact remains that he has committed sins beyond redemption.${prompt}
In spite of those sins, I still wish to rescue him from the darkness. I no longer have a mortal body with which to act, and so the most I can do is guide you in my stead.${prompt}
You will need the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, a key that bridges the void between Vana'diel and that other world.${prompt}

It is said that there are items in this world that gain a soul of their own through contact with the thoughts and dreams of other living creatures. The ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} is one of those items.${prompt}

You must look for the Goblin peddlers. They are certain to have knowledge of the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}. When you have it safely within your grasp, seek out the markings that we left behind...${prompt}

That world is a land now draped in the blackest night. We can pass from one world to the other, but without the physical forms lost to us thirty years ago, there is little we can do to intervene.${prompt}
Raogrimm is the one who... No, the world has been divided into separate realms through the machinations of the new Shadow Lord.${prompt}

The Shadow Lord resides in the Xarcabard of the other reality. However, I fear you would be marching to your death should you go to confront him... I ask you to first obtain trophies from four of the alternate realms.${prompt}

We understand that there is little time to spare. But without a certain degree of power, it will be impossible to traverse the land the Shadow Lord holds in thrall. Show me your strength with the four trophies you bring back.${prompt}
Those whose fate is linked to his world will empower the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} to guide you...${prompt}
I never believed that my indifference to the state of other nations would cause harm to my beloved San d'Oria...${prompt}
As part of my penance, I will infuse the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} with what guidance I can.
And now I am needed, the one who cut down poor Cornelia. The man cursed with the brand of traitor...${prompt}
Sure, I got everything I wanted, but what was left to me in the end? For one rash action, all I gained was an empty title and irreconcilable guilt...${prompt}
I doubt you'll listen to the words of a traitor, but please, help free him from the bonds of his eternal night...

Our expedition was supposed to have been an allied effortaru, but not one of us was interested in the fate of the other nations. In our hasty-waste to outdo each other, we failed to see to the heart of the mattaru.${prompt}
Our attitudes led to the death of two of our members, and precipitated the birth of the Shadow Lord...
This sin does not belong on Raogrimm's shoulders alone. We all mustaru atone for our actions.${prompt}
Please help him. Help Raogrimm escape from his horrid-worrid darkness, forever this time.
Humes and Galka have never been the best of friends. I used to think that was just the way it was, and always would be.${prompt}

Responsibility for Raogrimm's trrransformation lies with all of us who traveled with him on that expedition. By sharing the blame for the crimes he committed as the Shadow Lord, we can finally call ourselves his trrrue companions.${prompt}
Let me help you on your path. May guiding light fill this ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
Raogrimm's fate is in your hands.
There is a broken branch thrust into the ground here.${prompt}

When the soul that was divided is whole once again, towering rage will take on physical form...

The Xarcabard of that other realm is shrouded in a vast darkness, preventing contact from the outside. Even those of us without material bodies are unable to penetrate that mist of eternal night.${prompt}
Until that mist clears, I cannot guide you to Xarcabard.
The next place you must venture is the twin of Vana'diel's Beaucedine. There you will find the last trophy to complete the set of keys we need.${prompt}

All five trophies combined with our power will create a synergistic force, allowing us to part the shroud for a few precious moments. It will open a path between worlds.${prompt}

Even after the blackest night, the golden sun always rises to begin a new morning.
This troubled land will soon have its dawn...of that I am certain.${prompt}

This land has borne the weight of my sins.

Put an end to this thirty-year nightmare, ${name-player}.
${lettercase: 1}${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}! Show us the path to Xarcabard!

Like a flame returning to a candle whose light has been extinguished...${prompt}
It is an endless succession of life and death. How many times has that cycle repeated itself in that damned abode?${prompt}

There is one thing that bothers me. Whatever happened to the original wielders of the weapons and armor that the beastmen there now possess? If the statues in the shape of Orcs and such were once actual beastmen, then...? But I get carried away with my musings.${prompt}
Please pay no mind to my ramblings.
You have secured the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}. An incredible feat. It proves the strength of your conviction, and is one of the keys you will need to enter Xarcabard.${prompt}

Once you have them within your grasp, make your way to Beaucedine Glacier in the Northlands. Cornelia awaits you there.${prompt}

When you have all four trophies, travel to Beaucedine Glacier in the Northlands. You will find Cornelia waiting for you there.

That's it. That protocrystal I came across when I was doing research in Elshimo. The magical emanations coming from the crystal gave me a similar impression. An avatar? No, that can'taru be...${prompt}
I appear to have driftarued into my old habits.${prompt}

Gather all four trophies and hurry yourself on to Beaucedine Glacier. Cornelia will be waiting for you when you get there. But be wary, ${name-player}. The blackness enveloping that world grows ever deeper, ever darker...${prompt}
The beastmen of that world carry the spoils of prrrevious battles. Equipment that you or I would use.${prompt}
I'm not able to touch them in my prrresent form, but I feel something about those weapons and armor...something extrrraordinary.${prompt}
I don't mean that they're currrsed or anything like that! It's something more like, um, not ominous, but...

Xarcabard, I'm afraid, is another matter entirely...${prompt}

Let us make haste to the land where this all began. To Xarcabard...${prompt}

As long as I exist, he will never truly die...${prompt}

You who have touched the crystal, the one who holds immortal power within a mortal shell.

Of one thing I was certain.

What would you like to know about?
The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:${prompt}
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of “Flammen-Brenner.”${prompt}
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with “Flamme,” or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.${prompt}
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.${prompt}
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.${prompt}
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.${prompt}
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The “match score” section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.${prompt}
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.${prompt}
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.${prompt}
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.${prompt}

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed ${number: 0} members, or if there are fewer than ${number: 1} members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.${prompt}
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The ${color: 5}Master of Ceremonies${color: 1} (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.${prompt}
“LS Liga” is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.${prompt}
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.${prompt}

The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.${prompt}
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.${prompt}
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.${prompt}
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.${prompt}
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.${prompt}

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.${prompt}
Like Ballista, ${color: 5}quarry${color: 1} (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} and temporary items.${prompt}
However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can ${color: 5}trade${color: 1} a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.${prompt}
${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the ${color: 5}scout${color: 1} ability cannot be used in Brenner.${prompt}
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.${prompt}
The ${color: 5}sprint${color: 1} (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.${prompt}
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.${prompt}
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.${prompt}

Are you willing to discover the truth?
...This is a talisman bearing the symbol of the Goddess.${prompt}

I must conclude that the careful treatment of the holy tome had more to do with its value as a curiosity, rather than as an object of faith.${prompt}

I was thinking this out loud when an Elvaan girl passing by stopped to talk to me.${prompt}
But what about moogles? They've got wings, and they can fly, but you wouldn't call 'em birds.
They've got those funny antennae, too, but they're not insects, either.${prompt}
When I responded to her remark with the fact that both moogles and chocobos are animals, this is what she asked:${prompt}
Then what's the difference between animals and people?${prompt}
I answered, “People are smarter than animals.”
And then she retorted, “People sure are more sly!”${prompt}
Ahahaha, don't get all huffy on me!
I stopped to talk because what you were saying was important.${prompt}
People are all different from one another. They're different from animals, and different from plants.
This difference is what makes it all worth it.${prompt}
There are lots of ways to think and feel, and things to know and to believe.
But in the end, we all come from the same source.${prompt}
That's true for both people and animals.${prompt}
We all have this thing called a soul.
The souls of animals are pure and simple.${prompt}
You should ask someone how that chocobo was born.

Shalott said the chocobo's mother was from the stables in Bastok.${prompt}

How I wish I could go to Bastok to see her for myself.${prompt}

That Elvaan girl told me that both people and animals have souls.

According to Shalott, the chocobo's mother is from the stables in Bastok.

Lately, a lot of adventurers seem to be forgetting that a chocobo is an animal, not an object.${prompt}
You should keep that in mind as you're enjoying that easy ride through monster-ridden badlands.

She used to be the mount of a highly ranked general in the Bastokan navy.${prompt}
The general's son received the chocobo as a coming-of-age present, which he promptly took advantage of to leave Bastok.${prompt}
For the longest time, no one saw hide nor hair of man or beast--until eventually, Silver Comet came wandering back into town...alone.${prompt}
I heard later on that the general's son had lost his life somewhere in the wilds.${prompt}
Only Silver Comet had managed to return unharmed.${prompt}
In memory of his son, the general asked us to take the chocobo into our care...${prompt}
But then one day, Silver Comet was gone.
Some chocobo thief had stolen her.${prompt}
You say a chick of Silver Comet's is being kept in the Jeuno stables?
Anyway, after the theft, the general exhausted every avenue in search of his son's chocobo.${prompt}
He eventually found an adventurer who allegedly saw a chocobo drowning in the Pashhow Marshlands.${prompt}
That chocobo had the same markings as Silver Comet.${prompt}
If you want to try talking to that adventurer, you should go to the outpost in the marshlands.${prompt}
He's given up the adventuring life, it seems.
Now he earns his daily bread by seeing to the needs of the soldiers at the outpost.${prompt}
I got no time for adventurers.${prompt}
You say you got business with me?${prompt}
What the hell are you bothering me about that old chocobo story for?
This place gets too wet and too dark too quick to be wasting time chatting.${prompt}
If you bring me some ${item-plural: 1[2]}, I might be willing to give you the time of day.${prompt}
Yep, three of those ought to do it.
I'll give you until the day after tomorrow.${prompt}

You wanted to hear about that chocobo, right?${prompt}
She was one of the fastest chocobos I've ever ridden, but damn near uncontrollable.
I don't know how Silver Comet's owner handled her.${prompt}
I guess the death of her former owner is what sent her off the edge.
That chocobo wasn't right in the head.${prompt}
She threw herself headlong into the marshes.
Thought my number was up, I can tell you!
When I saw her in the stables, she was wearing a collar attached to a chain.${prompt}
That wasn't to keep the general's mount from being stolen--it was to keep Silver Comet from flying the coop, so to speak.${prompt}
Said that if Silver Comet was released, she would be able to find Shooting Star.${prompt}

Their love was a pure, uncomplicated thing, much more so than what people feel.${prompt}

I think the story of Silver Comet and Shooting Star helped me to really understand what she meant.${prompt}
Well then, I suppose I'll have to tell you the whole tale.${prompt}
Silver Comet and Shooting Star never really died.${prompt}
Shooting Star was a special chocobo that was attacked by an evil man.${prompt}

But Shooting Star was still being chased by the evil man, so we had to hide him away.${prompt}
We took him to a place in the west of Batallia Downs, where that villain would never find him.${prompt}
But the bad man was clever. He knew that if he had Silver Comet, her bond to Shooting Star would lead them right to the chocobo's hiding place.${prompt}
Silver Comet was one smart chocobo, though.${prompt}
She deliberately dove into the marshes to force the villain from her back.${prompt}
It was an extremely dangerous thing for Silver Comet to do.${prompt}
She had to protect her mate from the man who meant to hurt him.${prompt}
Silver Comet swam through the muck and dragged herself free of the marshlands.
She was finally able to make it to Shooting Star's side.${prompt}
That's when I took off her collar and set her free.${prompt}
What happened to them after that?${prompt}
Did they live happily ever after?${prompt}
And the youngest of the brood they raised together is that chocobo right over there.${prompt}
The villain of this tale is still lurking around somewhere.${prompt}
That's why you can never tell anybody what you've heard here today.
You want to keep that chocobo safe, right?${prompt}
Don't forget how Silver Comet never gave up on her mate.${prompt}
Even when those they love and believe in have gone, animals will keep on striving.${prompt}
That's because animals come from the same source as people.${prompt}

I would like to meet her again some day...${prompt}

Would you go out into the field and find the cards before the Goblins do?${prompt}
There is a variety of different sets. For each set you bring back safely, I'll secretly give you the present that we were going to give the Goblins, kupo!${prompt}

For starters, why don't you try finding ${article} ${item-article: 5[2]}, ${article} ${item-article: 6[2]}, and ${article} ${item-article: 7[2]}? That should throw those smelly Gobs for a real spin, kupo!${prompt}
Ah, I wish I could be there to see the look on those Gobs' faces when all they find is an empty hole.
Oh, right! Here's your reward, kupo!${prompt}
If you have any extra time on your hands, try finding more card sets, kupo!
We really have to stick it to those Gobs this year to show them who's boss!${prompt}
You don't know how much this means to us, kupo!
The Doll Festival has started, kupo!${prompt}
I heard from my moogle sources that this is a celebration for the health and happiness of girls, kupo.${prompt}
Apparently, the young lady and her beau would play empress and emperor, and would be joined by eight of their friends for the festivities, kupo.${prompt}
Why don't you try making a ten-person party as well?
We can all have fun celebrating the Doll Festival, kupo!${prompt}
It looks like you have all the members you need.
Time for the festival to begin, kupo!${prompt}
After squeezing my moogle sources some more, they told me that people used to eat these during the festival.
Here, you take one as well, kupo!${prompt}
It looks like you have all the members you need, kupo!${prompt}
In fact, the moogle grapevine tells me that this is the perfect Doll Festival combination, kupo!${prompt}
As a reward for your blind luc--I mean, “resourcefulness,” I'm going to give you lots of these treats, kupo!${prompt}
Just in case you didn't know, the three girls in your party represent ladies of the court who wait on the empress.
Moogles know everything about festivals, kupo!${prompt}
And by the way, the five guys in your group represent musicians who entertain the empress and emperor.
I wish I could play an instrument, kupo!${prompt}
Ah! This is a girl's festival and you don't have a girl in your party, kupo!${prompt}
I know I said this was a girl's festival, but you need at least one guy to play the emperor, kupo.${prompt}
What happened to your ten-person party?
You can't trick presents out of me, kupo!${prompt}
You can only celebrate the Doll Festival once a day.
Your party has different members all of a sudden!
Well, I guess I can give you this for having the right number of people at least, kupo!${prompt}
Your party has lost touch with its feminine side!
You need to find yourself a lady, kupo!${prompt}
You seem to have lost your male element.
Can't have the guys running away from you, kupo!${prompt}
At the request of a certain society, I am investigating the effects of the dreaded “Emptiness” on living beings.${prompt}
You appear to be a well-traveled adventurer.
Perhaps you have seen one of the Emptiness-ravaged creatures of which I speak?${prompt}
We have labeled these monstrosities “Empty Notorious Monsters,” or ENMs...${prompt}
Aha, so you have firsthand experience.
You probably don't need a scholar's explanation, but please indulge me...${prompt}

The material presence of ENMs has become temporary and insubstantial, meaning that those who have witnessed a particular ENM's existence are unable to encounter it again until a period of time has passed.${prompt}
My research has allowed me to measure the length of time between ENM manifestations.
Tell me, which ENM would you like to know about?${prompt}
I wish to know about the ENM in...
You won't be able to encounter that particular ENM until ${vanatime: 1} (${earthtime: 1} Earth time).${prompt}
The ENM in that area should be sufficiently manifest for your next encounter.${prompt}
You have no need of my expertise at the moment?
And now we come to the crux of the matter...${prompt}
If there is an ENM that you are currently able to locate, I strongly urge you to take action.${prompt}
These...creatures...are no longer natural beings of Vana'diel.
I cannot elaborate on the details, but know that the fate of the world depends on the early elimination of this threat...${prompt}
Then perhaps it is best if you forget this conversation entirely.${prompt}
I hope I have been of some assistance to you.${prompt}
This dark plague grows ever stronger...
If it is not stopped soon...${prompt}
Vicious villains are venting violently outside the city walls, kupo!${prompt}

We've divined that these creatures are invulnerable to normal weapons! And as if that wasn't enough, they're surrounded by a powerful aura that prevents them from being attacked at all, kupo!${prompt}
Our top moogle researchers have created a weapon that can injure these invaders!
The nomad moogles have also developed a magic that will annul that anti-attack aura, so be sure to pay them a visit before you engage the enemy, kupo.${prompt}
But be warned--this magic has the side-effect of preventing you from attacking any other monster for three whole days, kupo!${prompt}
Now you're ready to do battle, kupo!${prompt}
The ${item-singular: 0[2]} will absorb a part of the villain's aura every time you attack, kupo.${prompt}
Even if you don't topple the terror, bring the weapon to a moogle and you'll get a reward to match the amount of aura you've absorbed, kupo!${prompt}
By the way, these monsters are running around in samurai-style armor.
They may be hiding among other adventurers, so be on your guard, kupo!${prompt}
Bring it back to a moogle if you deal any damage to those samurai-styled scoundrels, kupo!${prompt}
If you want to cross swords with the invincible interlopers, equip the ${item-singular: 0[2]} and talk to a nomad moogle, kupo!${prompt}
Bring the weapon to a moogle after you've inflicted some damage to the marauding monsters and you'll get a reward to match the amount of aura you've absorbed, kupo!${prompt}
I can see the aura you've absorbed from the enemy!
With all the aura you've absorbed with the ${item-plural: 0[2]}, we've managed to create a new weapon.
We'd like you to have it, kupo!${prompt}
Which item will you use to enter?
We moogles have come up with a new game for you to enjoy called "Azimuth Circle"!${prompt}
Azimuth Circle is played in pairs!
First, find a partner and make a party, kupo!${prompt}
After you've done that, try to find a certain checkpoint located in this town! There are many checkpoints, but only one right answer, kupo!${prompt}
However...you can only check three points, kupo! But don't worry--once you've checked a point, you can look at it again any number of times!${prompt}
At each location lies a compass that points in the direction of your partner's special checkpoint! The directions will be indicated from the viewpoint of your partner, kupo～.${prompt}
Find both of your special checkpoints and exchange the items you receive from them! Bring those items to us. We will give you a reward in exchange, kupo!${prompt}
That's all there is to it, kupo!
To participate, make a party of two and talk to a moogle!${prompt}
That's all there is to it, kupo!
Your partner seems to already be participating in the game.
If you want to play together, ask your partner to cancel the current game and talk to a moogle again!${prompt}
Will you participate in Azimuth Circle with your partner, kupo?${prompt}
When both of you are ready, talk to a moogle! Then the game will begin, kupo!${prompt}
If you decide you want to play, just come with a friend, kupo!${prompt}
Our records indicate that you are presently signed up for Azimuth Circle somewhere else, kupo. Would you like to cancel your participation there?${prompt}
You want to stop playing Azimuth Circle?${prompt}
If you want to try again, speak to a moogle, kupo!${prompt}
Wow, you found it! Enjoy your reward, kupo!${prompt}
This isn't the item your partner found! We're still waiting on the item you got from your friend, kupo!${prompt}
You must wait for your partner to finish, kupo!
Would you like to cancel the current game instead?${prompt}
We can only pass out one item to you each day, kupo～!${prompt}
The direction of your partner's checkpoint is ${choice: 0}[east/southeast/south/southwest/west/northwest/north/northeast] as seen from your partner!${prompt}
There is a compass here that points to the direction of your partner's checkpoint. The compass is pointing ${choice: 0}[east/southeast/south/southwest/west/northwest/north/northeast].${prompt}
You see something lying on the ground!${prompt}
You cannot check any more checkpoints.${prompt}
Have you ever heard of Blitz Buffalo, kupo? It's a fast and frenzied buffalo-chasing fiasco ferried in from a land to the far west of Quon!${prompt}
We moogles thought it sounded like fun! So we rounded up a bunch of buffalos and set them loose in several places, kupo!${prompt}
Also, we've tied an item to each buffalo! Anyone who catches one can keep the item as a reward! It's a great opportunity for adventurers, kupo!${prompt}
But the buffalos aren't going to take a bunch of frantic adventurers chasing them lightly! You may have to knock one out before it yields its precious item, kupo!${prompt}
If you manage to lay your hands on a buffalo, you better prepare to be flung around, kupo... Kupohoho～.${prompt}
Of course, it wouldn't be too good if you ended up being the one chased either, kupo!
Just take care, and good luck, kupo!${prompt}
It's time once again for the Starlight Celebration!${prompt}
We moogles have collected piles and piles of presents for the adventurers this time, kupo!${prompt}
We'd like to give them to each person individually, but everyone always seems to be off on some adventure or another, and we can't keep them all straight! Could you help us, kupo?${prompt}
Give this card to an adventurer and tell him or her to bring it to a moogle. We'll have a present waiting, kupo!${prompt}
There are four cards in all. Once you hand the first card out, I will ask the adventurer who brings it back to help with the next.${prompt}
I have other things to do.${prompt}
Oh, I just remembered! I think that the cards are all addressed to people who are wearing red...${prompt}
If you change your mind, just let me know, kupo.${prompt}

This card is addressed to a ${choice: 1}[warrior/monk/white mage/black mage/red mage/thief/paladin/dark knight/beastmaster/bard/ranger/samurai/ninja/dragoon/summoner] with a level range in the ${number: 2}s, kupo!${prompt}

This card is addressed to a ${choice: 1}[warrior/monk/white mage/black mage/red mage/thief/paladin/dark knight/beastmaster/bard/ranger/samurai/ninja/dragoon/summoner] with a level range in the ${number: 2}s, kupo!${prompt}
I've got a present for you, kupo!${prompt}
I have a request, too. I've got presents for all the other adventurers, too, but I can't find everyone. I need your help, kupo!${prompt}

I need you to give this card to a ${choice: 1}[warrior/monk/white mage/black mage/red mage/thief/paladin/dark knight/beastmaster/bard/ranger/samurai/ninja/dragoon/summoner] with a level range in the ${number: 2}s, and have them bring it back to me, kupo!${prompt}
Oh, and the person should be wearing the same red clothing you are!${prompt}
I'll wait here and get the present ready! Thanks, kupo!${prompt}
Did you hand out the ${item-singular: 0[2]} yet, kupo? If you forgot who to give it to, just bring it to a moogle and you'll get a reminder.${prompt}
You forgot who to give the ${item-singular: 0[2]} to?

Find a ${choice: 1}[warrior/monk/white mage/black mage/red mage/thief/paladin/dark knight/beastmaster/bard/ranger/samurai/ninja/dragoon/summoner] with a level range in the ${number: 2}s and hand it over, kupo!${prompt}
You can only hand out one card a day, kupo!${prompt}
Are you bringing joy to the children of Vana'diel?
Don't keep all that happiness to yourself, now!${prompt}
What's the best way to make a child smile? Why, presents, of course!
Children nowadays want all kinds of goodies. I'm a bit behind the times, so I'm afraid I can't offer any good advice as to what would be the best present.${prompt}
But if you want to avoid suspicion, you'll need a red hat like mine. All smilebringers have them!${prompt}
They should be for sale somewhere around here, so snap one up if you want it!${prompt}

${choice: 1}[You haven't brought any happiness to the children!/You've done some good./You have done fairly well./You have given the children much joy!/You have brought smile upon smile to the children!/You have the children bursting with glee!/The children love you!] ${choice: 1}[What a disappointment./You just need to give a little extra effort!/Keep it up!/You make a good smilebringer./Excellent work!/Stupendous job!/Even I think you're great!]${prompt}
You can make good use of some of that joy you've brought to transport yourself to another nation. The children in other parts of Vana'diel need smiles, too!${prompt}
Sorry, but it looks like you don't have enough joy and happiness in your life to do that. You can earn some by giving presents to children, though!${prompt}
When did you say we were getting more of that magic dust stuff?${prompt}
I just put in an order with our suppliers, so it'll probably be a while.${prompt}
If you're in a hurry, you could go directly to the source.
Look up Chamama in the Federation of Windurst.${prompt}
I used these spectacles to change shape again, and now I'm stuck like this.${prompt}
I came back here to try and figure out what went wrong...${prompt}
Don't eat too many of those new spicy Galkan sausages.${prompt}
Do you have one of those...
You'll have to be a little more specific, sir.
Are you looking for a weapon? A shield? Some other type of goods?${prompt}
No, not a weapon or a shield...
Some type of food? A medicine? Furnishing of some kind?${prompt}
Can't quite place the name of it...${prompt}
The most common type would be the standard potion.${prompt}
A po...I'm sorry, just can't quite seem to...${prompt}
A P-O-T-I-O-N! Should I write it down for you!?${prompt}
I just don't understand you young people today.
I'll come back some other time when you're not so testy.${prompt}
Stay out of my store, you crazy old boot!${prompt}
I crashed into the wall when I was trying to run away!${prompt}
That would explain this crack in the lens...
It's time for Valentione's Day celebrations, kupo!${prompt}

There is an amazing type of chocolate whose filling is influenced by your feelings! When chocolate halves from a boy and a girl are matched together, the resulting whole produces a wonderful taste if the couple is meant to be, kupo!${prompt}
Young men and women in this town have broken their chocolates in two, hoping to meet that “special someone”!${prompt}
We want adventurers to help each of them find their perfect match, kupo!${prompt}
Here's what you should do, kupo: Take the two halves of a piece of chocolate from a Valentione Single.${prompt}
There are four lonely guys and four forlorn girls who need your matchmaking expertise. Try talking to someone of the same gender as you, kupo!${prompt}
When they hand over their chocolate halves, the singles will give you hints about the type of person they're head-over-heels for, kupo.${prompt}
You should be able to find an adventurer of the opposite gender who is holding a chocolate half from the perfect paramour for your Valentione Single.${prompt}
Trade the right halves of the chocolates with your adventuring colleagues and try to match them with the left half you received from the Valentione Single.${prompt}
When matching the halves, the single who gave up the left half may also meet the preferences of the single who gave up the right half.${prompt}
If both the singles meet each other's preferences, you'll have a match made in heaven, kupo!${prompt}

Don't forget who you got your chocolate from! Try to do too many things at once and you'll end up confused, so we suggest you hand in the chocolate halves to a moogle one pair at a time, kupo～.${prompt}
We moogles can take your lonely pieces and make them into one whole, complete chocolate!${prompt}
Then all you have to do is return the finished chocolate to the person who gave you the original piece. One bite will tell them if they've found their perfect partner!${prompt}
After you've returned a whole chocolate to four Valentione Singles, return to a moogle and collect your reward, kupo!${prompt}
While you're playing matchmaker, you might meet someone who puts a sparkle in your eye, too. Kupohoho～!${prompt}
Or maybe you could take advantage of this romantic occasion and make a party with that special someone while you exchange chocolates, kupopopo!${prompt}
Match up all the lovebirds you can, kupo!${prompt}
Four people hold the chocolates you seek. Make them into four whole chocolates and give one to each person. When you're finished, return to a moogle, kupo!${prompt}
You aren't planning on giving up, are you?${prompt}
If you want to start over, you'll have to get rid of the chocolates you have now.${prompt}
Just think of all those poor singles! You'll come back and help them later, won't you, kupo?
You should get rid of your chocolates in a subtle manner, so that you don't hurt anyone's feelings!
...We wouldn't want you getting a stomachache either, now would we, kupo?${prompt}
You've managed to gather complementary pieces of chocolate! Wait just a moment, now...${prompt}
What a beautiful piece of chocolate!
No need to thank me, now. Hurry and give it to the Valentione Single!${prompt}
Great work, kupo! You delivered chocolates to everyone! I've been getting lots of feedback about it! The response has been...${prompt}
Excellent! I thought my heart was going to flutter out of my furry little chest--you score ${number: 2} ${choice-plurality: 2}[point/points]! The power of love is amazing, kupo!${prompt}
Decent. You score ${number: 2} ${choice-plurality: 2}[point/points]. Everyone seems relatively happy! Not bad, kupo.${prompt}
Well, let's just say that some things just weren't meant to be. You score ${number: 2} ${choice-plurality: 2}[point/points].
Sorry, but I won't hand out a reward this time, kupo.${prompt}
My bag is filled with goodies for helpful adventurers like yourself! Take your pick!${prompt}
You must wait a bit longer to try again, kupo.${prompt}
You have to throw away all of your chocolates before playing again, kupo! It might seem a waste, but a rule is a rule!${prompt}
Oh, I've been waiting for this moment!
You'll help me find my perfect woman, right? Wow, thank you!!!${prompt}
Here's a piece of chocolate. I hope you bring back the best chocolate ever! Good luck!${prompt}
You still haven't brought any chocolate?
I've been waiting so long for this, so hurry up!${prompt}
You could go see a moogle or something!${prompt}
I'm going to savor its delicate flavor...and then I'll let you know what I think! Thank you!${prompt}
Hey. I heard you're playing the matchmaker around here.${prompt}

Hmph, guess I might as well let you know my type. I like ${choice: 3}[Humes/Elvaan/Tarutaru/Mithra], and I like 'em ${choice: 2}[cheerful/kind/shy/modest]. I leave this chocolate, and my future, in your hands. Well, go on. Get on with it.${prompt}
Oh well, keep it up. Looking forward to the results.${prompt}
I don't think I know you.${prompt}
Well, you were able to get a finished chocolate after all.
I need some time to think, though. After all, this could determine my future, so I will taste it later. Thank you.${prompt}
I have been waiting all my life for this!
You'll match me up with a girl, right? Wow! Me and a girl, together! Imagine!${prompt}

Oh, oh, let's see...I'll tell you exactly what I want! I want a ${choice: 2}[cheerful/kind/shy/modest] ${choice: 3}[Hume/Elvaan/Tarutaru/Mithra]! She also must cook things like steamed catfish every night, love watching Ballista, and have an interest in airship mechanics...er, ignore those last few requests. Anyway, here's some chocolate! Go get me a woman!${prompt}
Oh wow, thanks for doing this for me! I can't wait for my chocolate!${prompt}
What? What do you need? Nothing? Okay, then!${prompt}
Wooow, you really got a chocolate for me!
I'll let you know how it tastes later! Oh, thank you, thank you! I hope you can get a real, live ${choice-player-gender}[girlfriend/boyfriend] someday, too!${prompt}
I can meet...a woman? One that...likes me!? ...Oh, wow!${prompt}

Okay, okay...I'm going to tell you my type. Let's see...I'd like an, um...ack, this is so embarrassing. I'd like a ${choice: 2}[cheerful/kind/shy/modest] ${choice: 3}[Hume/Elvaan/Tarutaru/Mithra]! Y-yes, that's my order! (Oops...maybe I went too far just now...)
Not finished yet? O-oh, I'm sorry!${prompt}
You really got a chocolate for me! B-but, I don't see anywhere I could eat it now! I'll have to tell the moogle what I think later. Wow, this is great! See ya!${prompt}
Hiya! I've been waiting for you, sugar! Going to find a real sweetheart for me, are you? Yay!${prompt}
Listen closely, now! I liiike...${choice: 2}[cheerful/cool-headed/honest/shy] ${choice: 3}[Hume/Elvaan/Tarutaru/Galkan] boys! Teeheehee!
Here's a chocolate! Doesn't it look yummy? Good luck!${prompt}
What's wrong, pumpernickel? Not having trouble, are we? I really want a man, so please hurry up!${prompt}
You should go talk to a moogle!${prompt}
Oh, I've been waiting! I wonder what it tastes like! I'll let you know what I think later. Thank you so much!${prompt}
This looks like quite an exciting event, doesn't it? I hope I can also meet a nice guy.${prompt}
Here's a chocolate. You have my support! I wish you the best of luck!${prompt}
Hello! You seem to be working very hard. I'm really thankful!
But you needn't rush around so fast. Take your time! I can wait if it makes the job easier for you!${prompt}
Oh, I'm sorry. I think you've got the wrong person, but don't worry about it!${prompt}
Wow, you brought back a finished chocolate! Thank you so much!
I wonder what it tastes like. Teeheehee, I can't wait to try it.
I hope you meet someone special, too!${prompt}
Oh...hi! Um, today is...and I...well, that is...
<sigh> I can't bring myself to say it!${prompt}
Well, here goes nothing. I want ${choice: 2}[a cheerful/a cool-headed/an honest/a shy] ${choice: 3}[Hume/Elvaan/Tarutaru/Galkan] boyfriend!
A-and here's a chocolate... Th-thank you! (I can't believe I just said that!)${prompt}
Oh, y-you haven't brought a chocolate back yet? You really scared me, you know!
What? Th-this...could it be? You got me a chocolate! I can't eat it here, though...that would be sooo embarrassing. But I will eat it later, so thank you!${prompt}
I may not look like much, but I do hope to meet a nice guy...${prompt}
Please take this chocolate. It may not be the best in the world, but I hope you can use it to find someone.${prompt}
You're not finished with the chocolate yet, are you?
I knew it would be hard to find someone for a girl like me...${prompt}
I don't think there's anything I need...${prompt}
I see you got a chocolate for me. I can't tell how good it will be until I taste it, but maybe there's hope for me after all. Thanks so much for helping me.${prompt}
Oh, you think because I'm just a kid you can walk over and flash that badge at me for no good reason?${prompt}
True, I might look like a child now, but I know I was once a great warrior, and I can prove it. Your little badge doesn't impress me.${prompt}
This is no place for you to be wandering around. You outsiders never listen.${prompt}
I don't know about any of this “Aht Urhgan” business, but don't bring your problems to me.${prompt}
You want information on the “Empire of Aht Urhgan”?${prompt}
The alchemists from there are really top-notch--even better than the ones here!${prompt}
If you can get your hands on some Near Eastern alchemy products, I bet they'd sell for a nice amount of gil here.${prompt}
Beastmen are the same all over Vana'diel. All they ever do is cause trouble.${prompt}
A mercenary could take care of them, though...not a bad choice of profession.${prompt}
Good of you to drop by the Bat's Lair Inn!
Oh my, that's quite a shiny badge you've got there!${prompt}
The nation that made that badge must have pretty advanced technology to make it gleam so!${prompt}
Come and celebrate the Doll Festival with us, kupo!${prompt}
Come again and bring your friends! Each of them will also get an item, kupo!${prompt}
You can get items only once each day, so come back again tomorrow, kupo!${prompt}
Sneaky scoundrels have swiped the armor we brought in for the Feast of Swords, kupo!${prompt}
The villains wearing the armor are invulnerable to normal weapons! And as if that wasn't enough, they're surrounded by a powerful aura that prevents them from being attacked at all, kupo!${prompt}
Our top moogle researchers have created a weapon that can injure these armor-thieving hooligans!
The nomad moogles have also developed a magic that will annul that anti-attack aura, so be sure to pay them a visit while wearing the weapon before you engage the enemy, kupo.${prompt}
But be warned--this magic has the side-effect of preventing you from attacking any other monster for three whole days, kupo!${prompt}
Now you're ready to do battle, kupo!${prompt}
If you want to cross swords with the invincible interlopers, equip the ${item-singular: 0[2]} and talk to a nomad moogle, kupo!${prompt}
The Sunbreeze Festival's main event is back and better than ever!${prompt}
And this time, it's called Azimuth Circle...II!${prompt}
Would you like to know more, kupo?${prompt}
To play Azimuth Circle II, you'll need to team up with a partner and use a compass to search for a specific point.${prompt}
So your first step is to find that special somebody and form a party!${prompt}
Then talk to an event moogle, and we'll send you both out of town, kupo!${prompt}
We've set up several checkpoints outside.${prompt}
The goal is to find the correct one, kupo!${prompt}
What's that? You want a hint to help you find your checkpoint? Never fear, kupo--that's where Azima's portable compass comes in!${prompt}
And it couldn't be easier to use! All the adventurers have to do is sit there and wait!${prompt}
Once the compass has stabilized, it will give you a hint to help you find your partner's checkpoint, kupo.${prompt}
But be careful not to relax too much! Just sitting there staring at the clouds won't help you at all, kupo. You have to concentrate the way you do when healing your wounds!${prompt}
And keep in mind that you will only learn about your partner's checkpoint.${prompt}
So help each other out and nothing should go wrong!${prompt}

Once you reach your checkpoint, you should find something buried there that will prove that you made it! You and your partner should trade your items with each other and then hand them to a moogle, kupo!${prompt}
That's all there is to it, kupo! You'll get a prize if you succeed, so I hope you do well!${prompt}
You'll need a partner, so come back when you have one!${prompt}
Three makes a crowd, kupo! I'm looking for parties of two, and no more!${prompt}
Do you want to go outside and try the event with the person you're in a party with now?${prompt}
Is this partner okay with you?
I want to go with someone else...${prompt}
Come back when you've decided on a partner, kupo!${prompt}
I hope you enjoy the event together, kupo! When both of you are ready, just talk to one of us moogles to start!${prompt}
I'll be waiting here, so just let me know when you're prepared, kupo.${prompt}
You were wonderful together! This is all yours now, kupo...${prompt}
Kupo? This isn't your partner's item! Trade with your partner first, and give their item to me!${prompt}
We're just waiting on your partner now, kupo! Or would you like to cancel your participation?${prompt}
Your partner isn't ready yet, kupo. I'll wait, though.${prompt}
It looks like your partner doesn't want to go yet. Just let me know when your partner is ready, kupo.${prompt}
Oh, you're both wearing yukata! You must be ready for a real challenge, kupo! Don't worry, though--the prize is worth it!${prompt}
Kupo? That's not the partner you were with before! Changing partners in the middle of the game is against the rules, kupo.${prompt}
If you want to play with a different person, you should talk to one of us moogles and start the game over!${prompt}
I can only give each person one item a day!${prompt}
Later, I'll check to make sure you both found your checkpoints. I'll also give you this gate glyph so you can return to town, kupo!${prompt}
Kupo! I almost forgot the most important thing of all! Here, take this!${prompt}
${color-alt: 15}The moogle hands ${name-player} a small compass made from scintillant ore.
If you both manage to find your checkpoints, I'll give you a reward... So do your best, kupo! ${prompt}
What? You found a doll, kupo? Then trade it with your partner and give it to one of us moogles!${prompt}
Sorry, but if you don't reach the checkpoint yourself, I can't give out a reward, kupo...${prompt}
