The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.${prompt}
Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town.
If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.${prompt}
You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.
It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.${prompt}
Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.
The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.${prompt}
This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call “fewell.”
To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!${prompt}
As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require.
Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.${prompt}
With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing!

Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.${prompt}
The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!${prompt}
But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.${prompt}
If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.${prompt}
Take heart, though, as any materials inside your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will remain intact.
You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.${prompt}
Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.${prompt}
Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.${prompt}
Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions.
Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!${prompt}
You may be asking yourself, “Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?”${prompt}
Here's the good news: you don't have to!
For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.${prompt}
The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand.
At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.${prompt}
Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of ${item-singular: 0[2]}, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.${prompt}
Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that ${item-singular: 0[2]} may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.${prompt}
Mind you, ${item-singular: 0[2]} is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it.
Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.${prompt}
Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped.
May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!${prompt}
First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply.
You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.${prompt}
You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe.
Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.${prompt}
Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy.
If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.${prompt}
You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically.
Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.${prompt}
From here, it becomes a race against the clock!
Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.${prompt}
Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task.
First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.${prompt}
Next, you can begin to ${color: 5}feed fewell${color: 1} into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration.
Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.${prompt}
However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions.
Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.${prompt}

If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the ${color: 5}safety lever${color: 1} and ${color: 5}pressure handle${color: 1} to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.${prompt}
You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition.
Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.${prompt}
The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues.
You'll need to perform periodic ${color: 5}furnace repair${color: 1} should the furnace near its breaking point.${prompt}
It is also possible to ${color: 5}recycle strewn fewell${color: 1} during synergy.
While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.${prompt}
This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute.
As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.${prompt}
As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable.
There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.${prompt}
For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger.
Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!${prompt}
You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.${prompt}
In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well.
To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.${prompt}
Now let us return to the synergy process itself.
As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.${prompt}
If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance.
The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.${prompt}
Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills!
Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...${prompt}
What's an elemental surge, you ask?
Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.${prompt}

The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?${prompt}
...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell.
There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.${prompt}
Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe.
We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.${prompt}
Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients.
There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.${prompt}

Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.${prompt}
The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own.
The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.${prompt}

In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.${prompt}
First, equipment must be prepared by etching an aperture into which an elementally compatible piece of ${item-singular: 0[2]} can then be embedded.${prompt}
The type of aperture that may be etched will depend on the piece of equipment.
There are also pieces of equipment that, alas, may not be modified at all.${prompt}
If you are curious what manner of aperture may be etched into a particular piece of equipment, you need only trade it to me or one of my colleagues.${prompt}
As a general rule, the higher the level of the item in question, the more difficult the synergy process for creating an aperture will be.${prompt}
You will find that certain pieces of equipment may be etched with multiple apertures.
It is, however, only possible to create one aperture at a time.${prompt}
Etching requires the use of a corrosive substance we call mordant.
Deposit mordant into a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and the process will begin.${prompt}
My colleagues and I have a stock of mordant available for sale.
The best way to learn is to practice, so if you're curious, we encourage you to purchase some and begin experimenting!${prompt}
The difficulty of the synergy process when embedding evolith is decided by a number of factors.${prompt}
Such factors include the variety of aperture and evolith, as well as the quantity of evolith you seek to attach.
Embedding the first piece is not too difficult a task, but the second and third pieces will not go in so easily.${prompt}
To begin the embedding process, deposit your evolith into the synergy furnace along with a piece of equipment with a compatible aperture.${prompt}
When etching or embedding, the required elemental balance may be confirmed at any time during the synergy process, so let this be your guide.${prompt}
Should you ever wish to remove any apertures and embedded evolith from a piece of equipment entirely, you may do so with an ingredient we call ${color: 5}revertant${color: 1}.${prompt}
Toss the revertant in a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and its potent powers will restore your item to a pure and pristine state!
Be warned, however, that embedded evolith will be lost forever in the process.${prompt}
As you are no doubt already aware, synergy makes use of a highly combustible form of elemental crystals that we call “fewell.”
The more complex the recipe, the greater the quantity of fewell required.${prompt}
Veteran synergists know well the hassle of having to constantly monitor their fewell supply and procure crystals to replenish depleted stock.${prompt}
To free you of such trifling burdens and allow you to focus your mind entirely on your art, we synergy engineers are offering a convenient fewell replenishment service!${prompt}
For a nominal fee calculated based upon the current state of your fewell reserves, we will instantly refill you to full capacity.${prompt}
That's right--all elements in one simple transaction, directly to your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
Looking to fire up your furnace and enter the world of ${item-singular: 0[2]}?
If so, you've come to the right place!${prompt}
We're proud to offer a supply of the corrosive agent known as ${color: 5}mordant${color: 1} for sale.
With this, synergy newcomers can hone their skills and outfit their equipment with evolith-capable apertures in the process.${prompt}
Mind you, our stock is limited to only the most diluted, readily produced form of the stuff.
You'll find that it only has the strength to etch items of relatively low level.${prompt}
Etching high-powered equipment requires the use of more concentrated and potent forms of mordant.
As quantities are limited, we can offer these only in exchange for cinder.${prompt}
Those handy tricks of the trade that can mean the difference between a shiny new item and a major furnace meltdown.${prompt}
My colleagues and I are always eager to train fellow synergists in a wide range of techniques.
We can't do it all, though--you'll need to hone your synergy skill in order to benefit from our instruction.${prompt}
Bear in mind that certain techniques can only be imparted to students possessing specialized crafting knowledge.
For example, only skilled smiths will be able to comprehend the method for more efficient fewell feeding.${prompt}
Accomplished goldsmiths will be able to observe the inner workings of the furnace and stave off potential accidents.
You will find that all crafting skills--even those you may not expect--may be applied in some way to support the synergy process.${prompt}
Word has it that there are also pieces of equipment that can impart hidden synergy techniques to the wearer.
These, too, are said to be only accessible to skilled crafters.${prompt}
The moral of the story is this: while synergy skill is important, neglect not your other crafting skills.
To become a true synergy master, finding the proper balance is key.${prompt}
Synergy remains a young discipline, and researchers back at the institute are burning the midnight fewell in the hopes of uncovering the next breakthrough in our field.${prompt}
Research of late is centered around the cinder that is left behind as a by-product of each synergy operation.
Their composition, it would seem, has much to teach us of the true nature of the complex elemental reactions that go on within the bellies of these furnaces.${prompt}
We've even instituted a reward program for adventurers willing to contribute prime samples in the name of science.${prompt}
It would be no exaggeration to say that, to us, cinder is worth more than its weight in gold!
Bring it to me or my colleagues--preferably in large quantities--and you're sure to be pleased at what we can offer you in return.${prompt}
Wondering if your ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be outfitted with evolith, are you?
Well, you've come to the right place!${prompt}
A quick look at its composition should tell us all we need to know.
Congratulations! Your ${item-singular: 0[2]} can indeed hold ${choice: 1}[an/another] evolith aperture.
...Suitable for evolith of the following size and elemental affinity:
Maximum size: ${number: 1} / ${choice: 0}[/${icon: fire}/${icon: ice}/${icon: wind}/${icon: earth}/${icon: lightning}/${icon: water}/${icon: light}/${icon: dark}].${prompt}

Do you love synergizing as much as I love synergizing!?
'Cause if you do, you're gonna loooooove the recipes I have for you!${prompt}
View recipes for which skill level?
Oh, the ${item-singular: 0[2]}? Why, that's one of my favorite recipes, too!
What skills does it require? Let's see here...${prompt}
Well, look at this. All you need is a furnace and your own Goddess-given synergy skills to make that one!
You strike me as a ${choice-player-gender}[man/woman] who's looking to learn a thing or two about synergy.${prompt}
A life without intellectual curiosity is a life hardly worth living.
Should your eyes one day open to this truth, you are free to return.${prompt}
Synergy is both an art and a science: an evolution--nay, a revolution--in synthesis.${prompt}

Using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} in conjunction with a synergy furnace--the apparatus you see beside me--the synergist wields the power of myriad elements to fabricate a veritable host of potent items.${prompt}

What we call ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} serves to dispense fewell crystals--the lifeblood of the synergy process--whilst also protecting its contents from the volatile reactions that occur within the bowels of the furnace.${prompt}
Synergy furnaces have been installed throughout the city for the use of all synergists.
The crucible is sufficiently compact and lightweight that you can carry it with you.${prompt}
Initiating the synergy process is as simple as inserting your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} into a furnace and commencing the infusion of elemental fewell.${prompt}
Needless to say, what will happen from there is not quite so simple.${prompt}
Successful synergy is contingent upon maintaining elemental equilibrium.
The prescribed ratio, of course, will vary depending on the artifact you are attempting to create.${prompt}
You can increase the ratio of a particular element by burning the corresponding variety of fewell.${prompt}
But herein lies the rub: synergy is a still young science, and the technology we employ remains, shall we say...unstable.${prompt}
A bit too much fewell here, a wrong lever pulled there, and the percolating pot will explode, spitting scalding elemental guck every which way to Firesday.${prompt}
That's why smart synergists synergize in numbers.
Too many culinarians might spoil the broth, but when it comes to synergy, it's the more the merrier!${prompt}
If you're looking for ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, you've certainly come to the right place.${prompt}
I can sell you a splendid entry-level model for ${number: 0} gil.
A small price to pay to embark on a lifelong journey of scientific discovery, wouldn't you say?${prompt}
And because I like your enthusiasm, I've even stocked it to the brim with fewell for you!
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.

Welcome to the MHMU's porter service, kupo!
Which of your burdensome belongings shall I take off your hands today?${prompt}
Is your gobbiebag splitting at the seams? Mog Safe spilling over?
Why, an accomplished adventurer like yourself surely has more stuff than you know what to do with.${prompt}
That's where I come in, kupo.
I'll gladly hold onto your prized possessions, freeing you space to gather up even grander goodies.${prompt}
To make use of my services, first you'll need to buy one of these storage slips for the low, low fee of ${number: 19} gil.${prompt}
Storage slips come in numerous varieties, kupo, each corresponding to a different type of item.${prompt}
You'll want to peruse the fine print closely, so you don't end up paying good gil for a scrap of parchment useless for the particular item you wish to store.${prompt}
Not that we moogles would object to that sort of donation, kupo.${prompt}
Choose the item you wish to entrust, then trade it to me along with a single storage slip.
I will take the item and return the slip to you, marked with an invisible seal.${prompt}
It's plain as day to us moogles, so don't even think of trying to pull one over on us, kupo.${prompt}
When it comes time to retrieve your item, just trade to me a single storage slip--any slip--once again.${prompt}
I will present you with a list of all the items currently in my care, and you may choose the one you wish to withdraw.
What's more, no additional transaction fees will be incurred!
Pretty generous of us for a change, no?${prompt}
Now I bet you're wondering what the catch is, kupo.
So as not to disappoint you, there are a few!${prompt}
For one, any signed items will lose their signatures if you store them with me.${prompt}
Why, you say? Hey, even we moogles aren't perfect!
It's better for both of us if you keep your most precious possessions close at hand, kupo.${prompt}
Now listen up, because there's another catch, and it's a doozy.${prompt}
If you lose your storage slip, I won't be able to return your item. Ever. No ifs, ands, or buts!
No “I'm sorry, Mister Porter Moogle, it'll never happen again!”
Rules are rules, kupo, and someone has to keep them.${prompt}
Last, but not least, I can't accept equipment bearing Magian trial insignia.${prompt}
If you have such an item that you're simply dying to entrust to me, you'll have to abandon your trial first, kupo.${prompt}
And that's all there is to it.
This humble moogle can hardly wait to serve you!${prompt}
Do we have a deal, kupo?${prompt}

Very well! Your precious property is safe with me, kupo!${prompt}

A fair day to you, kind ${choice-player-gender}[sir/madam]! I am ${choice: 1}[Niscoliette/Prycillia/Chabobo], assistant to Atelloune. I suppose that makes me assistant to the assistant of his eminence, the great Professor Clavauert!${prompt}
We have made a fascinating discovery--chocobos, just like humans, are capable of falling in love!${prompt}
And you, my friend, come at the most fortuitous of times. How would you like to help me, erm...spur on the emotions of lovelorn chocobos?${prompt}
Too hoo hoo, came to lend your aid once more?
I'm always up for a new experience!
And just so we're clear, this is all for the benefit of the chocobos. I wouldn't even THINK of using you for my own research gains!${prompt}
Is that so? I guess winning battles of the flesh doesn't mean you can win battles of the heart. Amateur.${prompt}
If you change your mind, you know where to find me.
(<Sigh> I'll have to actually do my own research for once.)${prompt}
So, what's the first way into someone's heart? Presents! First, you'll need to search for and “dig up” a tantalizing gift!${prompt}
You've only got ${number: 0} tries. Remember, the more gifts you give to chocobos, the more easily they swoon. Such simple creatures.${prompt}
Truly let it wither on the vine?
How callous! All I wanted was to bring in dat...I mean bring darling chocobos together as soul mates!${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${article} ${item-article: 2[2]}! Way to show me how it's done! ${choice: 0}[/What a wonderful gift!/This'll make the best present ever!♪]
Why, it's like the locations of these presents change depending on the day! Hmm? “Why do I know these things?” Silly, I'm a scholar!${prompt}
It's gotta be related to the day of the week. Call it women's intuition!${prompt}
Oh, come on! Cupid's arrows are supposed to strike true, not go tumbling to the ground!${prompt}
Maybe he'll perk up a bit later? Why don't you give it another go then?${prompt}
You know what I do when I'm depressed? Eat some sweets. Maybe this poor fella just needs to eat something to cheer him up.${prompt}
Now that we've got a present, it's time for step two!${prompt}
Well, well, just what have you brought me? Oh, yes, this will do nicely. Our chocobo friend will be back up and kweh-ing in no time!${prompt}
The chocobo has a special twinkle in his eye.
Next up: sweet nothings! Can't win the affections of the fairer sex without a silver tongue!${prompt}
Though they may not be able to comprehend your words, the language of love is universal!${prompt}
You've got a total of ${number: 0} chances. Think of it like speed dating! The glibber your jibe, the more they swoon!${prompt}
Absolutely perfect! You're no stranger to love, that's for sure!${prompt}
What's this? No sweet nothings? Yes, yes, I know that true love needs no words, but when a romance is still budding, you've got to give it your all! Or...would you rather call it quits?${prompt}
Most wondrous! Now that report of mine will be...<cough> Excuse me. What? Why are you looking at me like that? Quick, out with the magical phrase!${prompt}
The chocobo blinks and cocks his head to one side.
Hmm... Maybe if you didn't beat around the bush? Try telling it like it is.${prompt}
Maybe these baby chocobos can provide some kind of hint?${prompt}
Now that you've found just the right words, it's time to take things to the next level!${prompt}

According to my volumes of data, it seems ${choice: 1}[you two have a chilly relationship, but don't give up yet!/you're on the cusp of winning its heart./you two are on fire! You might as well get hitched!]
Speed! Luck! Come on, ${choice-player-gender}[hon/sweetie], love isn't a battlefield, it's a race!${prompt}
Cast your fate to Lady Luck!
Route ${number: 0} has already been selected by your rival.
Aw, you poor thing, looks like you chose the wrong path to love.${prompt}
W-wow! What a turn of events! Love knows no bounds, as the saying goes! Just wait until the profess... I mean, uh, good going!${prompt}
After all that hard work you did with your lovely present and those three magic words... Maybe love is all about luck and timing after all.${prompt}
Well done! My little cupid has veritable wings sprouting from ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] back! The more love, the more data...dates! Dates they will go on!${prompt}

With all you've done for me...err, the chocobos, it's only fair that I give you a little something in return. A token of my appreciation, if you will. Of course, you're welcome to come back any time!${prompt}

“Records of Eminence is a system brought to you by the caring folks at the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network. Set your own objectives whenever you desire, and fulfill them to receive compensation.${prompt}

“You will be rewarded with gil and sparks of eminence, which serve the same function as points, notes, credits, and other such methods of quantifying one's greatness. As an extra incentive, adventurers will earn three times the amount of sparks for completing an objective the first time.${prompt}
“Completed objectives will vanish from your quest list unless they are repeatable. In the event that you wish to make room for different objectives, you will need to remove them manually.${prompt}

Unity Concord is a system promulgated and managed by the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network.${prompt}
Participating adventurers are able to receive a variety of benefits and rewards just by engaging in their everyday activities.${prompt}
“Unity” is a catchall term that refers to the group that participants belong to.${prompt}
Unity leaders are individuals who have strong ties to adventurers' activities and are sterling representatives of their home nations.${prompt}
Members of the same Unity can converse with each other over great distances through the use of specialized figurines known as “${keyitem-plural: 1[2]}.”${prompt}
Chat settings may be changed by selecting “Status” from the main menu, and choosing “Unity Info” under the “Unity” submenu.${prompt}
You may not always be able to join the chat if too many players are participating at once.${prompt}
Those belonging to a Unity are able to undertake special Records of Eminence objectives related to Unity Concord activities.${prompt}
The three pertinent categories include shared objectives, Unity leader-specific objectives, and Wanted battle objectives.${prompt}
Shared objectives may be taken regardless of which Unity you have joined. These tasks can be undertaken at any time, and change every day at midnight (JST).${prompt}
Unity leader-specific objectives are tied to the Unity's eponymous leader and change each week.${prompt}
“Wanted” objectives center around vanquishing particularly heinous foes that terrorize Vana'diel.${prompt}
These objectives are of a higher caliber, and thus require currency known as “Unity accolades” to undertake.${prompt}
Shared and leader-specific objectives provide more accolades than run-of-the-mill objectives.${prompt}
Vana'diel has always been plagued by nefarious foes pillaging the landscape, but relatives of some of the more heinous ones have been spotted lately.${prompt}
The A.M.A.N. has deemed it necessary to eliminate these Wanted targets, and has notified Unity members that they are of the utmost priority.${prompt}
A list of these foes can be viewed at any time by selecting the appropriate subcategory under the objectives list.${prompt}
Unity Concord representatives are able to provide participants with transportation to the areas where these threats can be found.${prompt}
Though tackling the profane will likely require participation of your allies, the objective can be undertaken so long as at least one person has set the appropriate objective.${prompt}
When you set the objective and commence the battle, the requisite number of Unity accolades will be deducted from your total.${prompt}
Successful challengers will be rewarded with special rewards in addition to the normal sparks of eminence.${prompt}
No Unity accolades will be charged should you commence the battle without having the appropriate objective set, but the rewards you can reap from your efforts will be limited.${prompt}
You can snatch unparalleled equipment and materials from the slain corpses of Wanted targets.${prompt}
An A.M.A.N. specialist versed in arcane harmonization has kindly offered to use these materials to bring out the latent potential in such pieces.${prompt}
One of the Unity guides will be pleased to accept certain combinations of equipment and materials to begin the process for you.${prompt}
A number of accolades is required for this service, but the precision and accuracy of her methods are without equal, and there is no worry of your equipment being destroyed.${prompt}
You can use specified materials to add new attributes to equipment that has been upgraded.${prompt}
Utilizing additional materials after adding an attribute can accumulate Reinforcement Points for the equipment and increase its rank.${prompt}
Increasing your equipment's rank can boost its attributes, while some equipment can also have additional attributes added later.${prompt}
Speak to the Unity guides after gathering the necessary materials for your equipment in order to add attributes to it or increase its rank.${prompt}
The first time you add an attribute to a piece of equipment will require the use of Unity accolades.${prompt}
It also requires that you first complete a specific Records of Eminence objective.${prompt}
The work you request will be carried out on-site by a specially trained Unity guide.${prompt}
Completing Records of Eminence objectives as part of a Unity will reward you with Unity accolades in addition to sparks of eminence.${prompt}
These accolades not only serve as a symbol of prestige, but can also be exchanged for a variety of services.${prompt}
Some of these services include purchasing items, securing battle zones for hunting Wanted targets, fees for strengthening equipment, and more.${prompt}
Please note that you may only exchange a maximum of ${number: 0} accolades per week (Earth time).${prompt}
You may switch Unities once during the Unity ranking tabulation period.${prompt}
This is not a decision to be taken lightly, for switching Unities will cause you to forfeit any benefits you were receiving from your previous one.${prompt}
This process requires a fair deal of paperwork, and the A.M.A.N. will charge you an accolade fee based on your rank.${prompt}
However, your valorous deeds remain wherever you choose to go, and you will not lose any other accolades.${prompt}
Rankings are decided through the combined efforts of each of the Unity's members.${prompt}
The A.M.A.N. tabulates all the good deeds done during a period of time and confers benefits on a Unity for the following ranking period.${prompt}
Some of these benefits include changes to Unity accolades gained and the effects of equipment earned from Wanted battles.${prompt}
Yes, you read that correctly--the attributes of certain equipment will increase in line with your Unity's ranking.${prompt}
On the other hand, members of a Unity that finds itself on the lower rungs will enjoy an increase in accolades and capacity points earned to help bring them up to par.${prompt}

Additionally, an individual's evaluation is the sum of the accolades they have earned divided by ${number: 0}. A Unity's ranking is the average of all eligible members' individual evaluations.${prompt}

The A.M.A.N. does not look kindly on those who only seek to siphon rewards from others' hard work, and thus only confers these boons on those who have collected at least a certain number of accolades.${prompt}
Unity leaders may also join you as alter egos for a limited period of time.${prompt}
Those with evaluations of ${number: 0} or greater will be able to call forth an alter ego of their leader to assist them in battle.${prompt}
Those eligible will be able to use the alter ego from the moment they acquire the appropriate ranking level until the tabulation after the next.${prompt}
A leader's alter ego grows in power the higher their Unity is ranked.${prompt}
Changing Unities will remove the player's ability to call forth their leader's alter ego at the moment they leave their current Unity, regardless of personal evaluation or remaining time.${prompt}
A player will have to work hard in their new Unity and acquire a sufficient evaluation to regain the ability to call forth their new Unity's leader.${prompt}
It goes without saying that players must first have acquired a Trust permit in order to avail themselves of this opportunity.${prompt}
Those desiring to participate should seek out one of the initiative's representatives, dressed in green, in one of the three nations.${prompt}

I think we'd better split up. You go after Cornelia while I get some help.${prompt}
The mines aren't exactly the best place for someone to wander around unprotected.${prompt}
I'll head over as soon as I can. If what Cornelia heard is true, there's a chance you'll run into this Galka before her--so if you do, make sure he's safe, okay?${prompt}
Hey, ${choice-player-gender}[Mr./Ms.] Adventurer, would you mind going after Cornelia?${prompt}
She's probably gone to the Zeruhn mines all on her lonesome.${prompt}
I'll head over as soon as I can. If what she heard is true, there's a chance you'll run into the newly reborn Galka before Cornelia--so if you do, make sure he's safe, okay?${prompt}
Ah, well look who it is. You must be concerned about the Galkan child too.${prompt}
Of course. I should have known Gumbah would worry about me.${prompt}
Between him and the foremen, everyone I've talked to today is too concerned for my well-being. They won't even let me further into the mines.${prompt}
It doesn't make any sense. If they're that insistent on looking after me, then why wouldn't they be twice as interested in the young one wandering around unaccompanied?${prompt}
When I pointed that out, Rasmus said, “Oh, right. We did see him further in...”${prompt}
I know! They might not let me proceed, but surely they'd have no such qualms about you!${prompt}
Maybe some of the other foremen would know more. Could you ask them about the Galkan child and go looking for him?${prompt}
I'll be waiting for Gumbah to join up. Best of luck.${prompt}
Cornelia is waiting for me in the Zeruhn Mines?${prompt}
Then I guess I should go get my things together and head over to meet her. I promise to be quick.${prompt}
What!? There actually was a Galkan child in Zeruhn!?${prompt}
I'll get some Galkan adults and rush over there with them! You have to protect the child until we get there!${prompt}
Thanks again, ${choice-player-gender}[Mr./Ms.] Adventurer. Without you, who knows what that Goblin would have done to him--to Raebrimm.${prompt}
He's been through a lot, and is resting here in the city. He was scuffed up a little, but we expect him to make a swift, safe recovery.${prompt}
Still, don't you think it's a little out of character, even for a Goblin, to attack a child? What's that all about?${prompt}
Ah, Cornelia! Were you able to learn anything?${prompt}
I'm afraid I've turned up nothing.${prompt}
I asked the Mythril Musketeers for help, and even though they gladly agreed to look into things, it might take a while before they find out anything concrete.${prompt}
I guess it can't be helped, but it's still pretty frustrating. The Goblin might come after Raebrimm again, and we've got to be prepared.${prompt}
I agree, and came up with a plan. What if we were to disguise Raebrimm?${prompt}
Yeah. You know, a little wig here, a little makeup there, and no one will be able to tell that it's him!${prompt}
And if there's anyone who's an expert in making disguises to avoid attention, it's me.${prompt}
Avoid attention? You? The guards have seen through your tricks so many times that I've started to keep a running tally.${prompt}
Uh, well, be that as it may...${prompt}
Failure is the first step to success, right? And I know just the fashionista to help us pull this off.${prompt}
How do you know a fashionista!?${prompt}
Why, everyone knows Brygid. And I think she owes me a favor.${prompt}
You know how much she values her reputation. If anyone can help us disguise Raebrimm, it's her.${prompt}
Why do I have a bad feeling about this?${prompt}

I wouldn't say I have a “bad feeling,” but there is one small hurdle to climb. She says that she's looking for new entrants in a show that's going to start soon and doesn't have much time to spare for us.${prompt}
And that's where you come in!${prompt}
If you can help Brygid with her show, then she'll absolutely have to assist us! C'mon!${prompt}
Darn it, she ran off again. Leave it to her to just assume we'll follow this plan to the letter.${prompt}
But I guess we don't have any choice now, do we? I know it's an odd request, but think of it as helping to protect an innocent child. Let's go find Brygid.${prompt}
I know that Cornelia's plan may sound a bit half-baked, but I can't come up with anything better. Let's go find Brygid.${prompt}
${choice-player-gender}[Mr./Ms.] Adventurer, you remember our friend Raebrimm, right? The Galkan child in the unforgettable Goblin getup?${prompt}
Oh, good. I'm glad to hear that your mind is sound.${prompt}
How could you forget? After all, you were the one who went to the Zeruhn Mines and saved him from a vicious assault.${prompt}
I've got some news on the black-clad Goblin that was threatening him.${prompt}
Evidently we've been able to learn about where the menace was headed next.${prompt}
Cornelia asked the Mythril Musketeers for their help in tracking the beastman down--and I'm pleased to report that they agreed to aid us.${prompt}
Oh, and look who's with you!${prompt}
${name-player}, your timing is impeccable, as always. I wanted to share this with the both of you.${prompt}
<Sigh> How could I say no to that face?${prompt}
We Mythril Musketeers have worked tirelessly to gather information on your little Goblin problem. While we haven't identified who exactly that little beastie is...${prompt}
We do know that a strange Goblin was seen flitting about the markets, darting from shadow to shadow in an attempt to avoid detection.${prompt}
I would imagine that a Goblin dressed in black from head to toe would arouse some amount of suspicion.${prompt}

Aye, and surely we would have heard more reports if the beast moved via ordinary means...but his modes of transportation are a bit more arcane, which would explain why he is able to mostly avoid detection in his search for Raebrimm.${prompt}
The good news is that Brygid's disguise seems to be working, because Raebrimm remains unharmed.${prompt}

In fact, that's why we have any information at all--the Goblin must be getting desperate and resorting to more overt means of tracking his quarry, and just now we got word that someone matching his description was spotted in Korroloka Tunnel.${prompt}
Is it really? I mean, we haven't exactly stopped his advance.${prompt}
Fear not--we have no intention of letting him walk. In fact, I ordered Naji to go after him posthaste.${prompt}
And by “we,” I mean the Mythril Musketeers. Miss Cornelia, you are to remain within the city walls.${prompt}
You're going to let Naji take the lead AND make me stay here!?${prompt}
No way. I've got to see this through to its conclusion.${prompt}
While I share your distaste at letting Naji run point...${prompt}
He is a Mythril Musketeer, unreliable though he may be.${prompt}
Still, I agree that it couldn't hurt to send backup of some sort. Adventurer, I'd wager you're more than willing to volunteer.${prompt}
Most assuredly. We've got to let Raebrimm know that we will do anything to ensure his safety.${prompt}
I know it's only Korroloka Tunnel, but Naji is definitely going to be in over his head.${prompt}
Would you mind heading over? Not for my sake, but for Raebrimm's.${prompt}
Raebrimm filled us in on what happened. You have my sincere thanks.${prompt}
But “Gloom Phantom,” eh? What a straightforward moniker.${prompt}
And the three of them call themselves “The Destiny Destroyers.” Well, at least their naming sense is on point.${prompt}
I've known beastmen to be a bit odd, but an egg hunt? Something tells me they don't simply want initial eggs.${prompt}
${name-player}! I heard that everything went well.${prompt}
You're just the person I wanted to see, too. There's something I don't quite understand.${prompt}
He hasn't returned to file his report, and it's well past time for him to make his way back the city.${prompt}
The three? You mean the Goblin and friends?${prompt}
While his desire to get to the heart of the matter is commendable, that doesn't change the fact that he left the Galkan child behind.${prompt}
Nor did he send word back of his intentions.${prompt}
I hope everything's okay. What if he was hurt? Or captured?${prompt}
No, others have already reported seeing him back in the city with no apparent injuries.${prompt}
Until he reports in, I suppose I'll have to ask you, Gumbah, to get the full story from Raebrimm.${prompt}
Hmmm... Although I did order Naji to track down the source of the problem, he may have gotten in over his head.${prompt}
But the most critical mission--ensuring Raebrimm's safety--appears to have been a rousing success. You have my thanks.${prompt}
We couldn't have done it without you, ${name-player}.${prompt}
Gumbah, I'd like to hear what happened directly from Raebrimm's mouth. Perhaps we might glean some deeper insight into this matter.${prompt}
Leave it to Naji to go traipsing off without backup.${prompt}
According to Raebrimm, the Goblin succeeded in...whatever it was that they were trying to do.${prompt}
As long as they'll leave him alone, though, does it really matter whether or not they're brought into custody?${prompt}
That may very well be, but I'm afraid we're left with more questions than answers. I'd like to talk to Raebrimm myself.${prompt}
Of course. I'll get him right away.${prompt}
${name-player}, there's something that's been bothering me.${prompt}
What exactly was the deal with that egg...or eggshell, I suppose?${prompt}
Huh? You think they had a case of the munchies?${prompt}
If it was a whole egg, then I would understand, but wasn't it just an eggshell?${prompt}
I wish I knew more about it, but Gumbah practically had my hide the last time I asked him about his own journey...${prompt}
I suppose you'd rather not talk about it.${prompt}
Maybe you think I'm just some girl in over my head, like everyone else...${prompt}
Cornelia, the conclusion we came to is that the Goblin wasn't after the eggshell itself, but rather a whole egg.${prompt}
They were trailing Raebrimm because they caught the scent of it, but what they found was just a “shell” of what they thought it would be.${prompt}
That's the lamest pun I've ever heard.${prompt}
Perhaps that mystery will have to wait for later, and we'll have to content ourselves with Raebrimm's freedom.${prompt}
${name-player}, we'll let you know if we hear anything else.${prompt}
As will the Mythril Musketeers. Naji's heart is in the right place.${prompt}
I'd like to give you something other than just platitudes for your efforts.${prompt}
Me too. It's a special recipe favored by my extended family.${prompt}
Your help was critical in ensuring Raebrimm's safety. Here's a little something from me and Cornelia.${prompt}
This is an explanation of the Assist Channel feature, which allows new and returning players to seek help from veteran adventurers.${prompt}
You must take on the “${unknown: 0x01054082808080}” Records of Eminence objective before receiving the explanation.${prompt}
You must complete “${unknown: 0x01054082818080}” before taking on the “${unknown: 0x01054082808080}” Records of Eminence objective.${prompt}
What do you want to learn about?
How can I post a message?
What are Thumbs Up and Warnings?
What happens if I am muted?
When do my posting rights expire?
The Assist Channel is a special chat channel that allows adventurers to ask questions and receive advice from veteran players known as mentors.${prompt}
Press the space bar to bring up the text window at the bottom of the screen and type “/assistj (your message)” or “/assiste (your message)” to post your message.${prompt}
You can also use “/aj” for “/assistj”, and “/ae” for “/assiste”.${prompt}
Additionally, pressing CTRL+Q will display “/assistj” or “/assiste” in the text window for you.${prompt}
You can change the CTRL+Q shortcut command...${prompt}
...by going to Main Menu > Config > Misc. 2 > Key Assignment > Commands > Chat: /AssistE or /AssistJ.${prompt}
It is recommended that you use “/assistj (/aj)” when posting in Japanese, and “/assiste (/ae)” when posting in English.${prompt}
You must meet one of the following conditions in order to post to the Assist Channel.${prompt}
You may post messages from the moment you first set foot in Vana'diel.${prompt}
As a returning player, you may post messages upon logging in with a character that has not logged in for at least 48 days.${prompt}
You may post messages as long as you remain a mentor to other players.${prompt}
New players and returnees may post messages until they have been logged in for a total of 48 hours since first receiving their posting rights.${prompt}
If you wish to check how long you can continue to post for, speak to an ${name-npc} and choose "When do my posting rights expire?" to see how much time you have left.${prompt}
The Assist Channel can only be used in the following areas.${prompt}
You cannot post or read messages outside of the areas listed above.${prompt}
Even in areas where messages are allowed, you cannot post consecutive messages.
Please wait a while after posting a message.${prompt}
Mentor messages are accompanied by a flag (${icon: 0xEFEF}/) marker.
This marker indicates the mentor's reliability (Mentor Class) and experience as an adventurer (Mastery Rank).${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Mentor messages are accompanied by a flag (${icon: 0xEF2F}) marker.

Phrase en Anglais: As a mentor's Mentor Class increases, the color and shape of the marker will change: ${icon: 0xEFEF}/ > ${icon: 0xEFEF}9 > ${icon: 0xEFEF}C${prompt}
A ${icon: 0xEFEF}C marker is a sign that the mentor has earned the highest levels of trust from other adventurers.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: As a mentor's Mentor Class increases, the color and shape of the marker will change: ${icon: 0xEF2F} > ${icon: 0xEF39} > ${icon: 0xEF43}${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: The number affixed to the marker is the mentor's Mastery Rank, and indicates how experienced the mentor is as an adventurer.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: A ${icon: 0xEF43} marker is a sign that the mentor has earned the highest levels of trust from other adventurers.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: The higher the number, the more experienced the mentor is.${prompt}
You can check your own Mastery Rank even if you do not serve as a mentor, so feel free to take a look every now and then if you are curious.${prompt}
You can check your Mastery Rank by going to Main Menu > Status > Profile.${prompt}
If you wish to speak directly to a mentor, you can search for mentors by going to Main Menu > Help Desk > Mentor Search.${prompt}
The “Thumbs Up” feature enables you to let mentors know when their comments proved to be especially helpful.${prompt}
Mentors who earn lots of “Thumbs Up” replies from other adventurers will see their Mentor Class increase.${prompt}
Remember to give a “Thumbs Up” to any mentor you feel helped you out or taught you something useful.${prompt}
A “Warning” is a feature that can only be used by mentors.${prompt}
Please use this feature when a post's contents are insufficient or otherwise may be construed as harassment.${prompt}

To send a “Thumbs Up” or “Warning” to another player, open the Chat Log Window and move the cursor over the relevant message and press the confirm button (Enter key) to bring up the evaluation menu.${prompt}
Evaluations can be made for 10 minutes following the designated player's latest post to the Assist Channel.${prompt}
You may send up to one “Thumbs Up” and one “Warning” per day (Earth time).${prompt}
The “Mute” feature places restrictions on your ability to post, meaning that other players will be unable to see the messages you post to the Assist Channel.${prompt}
Please refrain from posting unsuitable content so that the veteran adventurers are not forced to mute you.${prompt}
Mute status can be removed by players that have the necessary Mute List access rights, or it will be removed automatically 24 hours (Earth time) after the mute status was enabled.${prompt}
You are free to post messages to the Assist Channel until you decide to stop serving as a mentor.${prompt}
You may post messages to the Assist Channel until ${ts-hour: 0}:${ts-minute: 0} on ${ts-month: 0}/${ts-day: 0}/${ts-year: 0}.
If you log out while you still have time available, your remaining time will be carried over to the next time you log in.${prompt}
You are about to lose the ability to post messages to the Assist Channel.${prompt}
You are unable to post messages to the Assist Channel.${prompt}
Take on the “${unknown: 0x01054082808080}” Records of Eminence objective from the Tutorial section of the Records of Eminence Menu and speak to the A.M.A.N. liaison.${prompt}
Fair greetings to you, wanderer. I am a linkshell concierge, charged with uniting lone explorers of Vana'diel with linkshells of similar goals.${prompt}
How may I help you today?${prompt}
It was my pleasure to meet with you this fine day. May you encounter many friendly faces throughout your travels.${prompt}
Excellent. Please select which linkshell you are interested in contacting.${prompt}
In the interest of fairness, I am unable to distribute multiple linkpearls to someone on the same day. Please come back tomorrow.${prompt}
It is my sincere pleasure to bestow this upon you.${prompt}
Your new linkshell is beyond doubt filled with many looking for new companions. Be sure to say a few words of greeting.${prompt}
I have prepared a small manual describing the importance of treating others with respect. Please have a quick glance at it when you have a moment.${prompt}
May your new linkshell provide you with fond memories that will last a lifetime.${prompt}
Though it pains me to say this, I have no ${item-plural: 0[2]} that meet your requirements at this time.${prompt}
Should you desire, I can cancel your registration.${prompt}
Should you desire to look for members, I can distribute ${item-plural: 1[2]} in your stead by utilizing the energies continued within your equipped ${item-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}
During the process, please equip either ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]} as Linkshell 1 and select “I'd like to hand out ${item-plural: 0[2]}.”${prompt}
One that step has been completed, I will ask you a series of questions.${prompt}
To cancel your registration, equip ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]} as Linkshell 1, speak to me again, and select the appropriate linkshell from the list.${prompt}
Unfortunately, only those equipped with ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]} as Linkshell 1 are able to distribute ${item-plural: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Once-in-a-lifetime meetings make for wonderful stories, but no treasure can compare to being part of a group of friends you can call home.${prompt}
Linkshell concierges such as myself bring together adventurers of similar interests.${prompt}
In a word, we match adventurers looking for linkshells with those linkshells interested in taking in new members.${prompt}
I accept ${item-plural: 0[2]} from linkshells the world over and distribute them to appropriate adventurers.${prompt}
This service is provided by the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network, and as such, anyone working for Vana'diel's greater good is eligible to participate.${prompt}
Additionally, please be aware that I am only able to offer you one ${item-singular: 0[2]} per day.${prompt}
Though we would like to offer this service free of charge, the network has its own expenses that must be paid, so we charge a nominal fee of ${number: 0} gil at the time of registration.${prompt}
It is also worth noting that ${item-plural: 0[2]} can only be registered by adventurers who have been active in Vana'diel for at least ${number: 1} days (Earth time).${prompt}
It is worth noting that each concierge may only register a maximum of ${number: 0} linkshells.${prompt}
Once the number of registrations has hit the limit, existing registrations will be canceled in order of oldest to newest.${prompt}
${color-alt: 138}Server maintenances will also immediately cancel all registrations, so be sure to keep your information up-to-date.
Thank you for taking the time to use our service. Let me confirm the information contained within.${prompt}
Shall I start looking for new members for a fee of ${number: 1} gil?${prompt}
I'm quite sorry to hear you decline. Please let me know if you change your mind.${prompt}
I will now ask you a series of questions about your preferences. Be sure to answer truthfully so that you can find new members that match your style.${prompt}
What days are you most active?
What days are you most active?
In the wee hours of the morning.
In the wee hours of the morning.
In the wee hours of the morning.
How many members are you looking for?
How many active members do you have?
How would you characterize your linkshell?
Style: ${choice: 0}[Do everything/Engage in hard-core battle content/Engage in casual battle content/Vanquish HNMs/Meet other new players/Assist each other/Engage in synthesis and trading/Nothing].

Most active: ${choice: 2}[Every day/Weekends/Weekdays/Mondays/Tuesdays/Wednesdays/Thursdays/Fridays/Saturdays/Sundays] ${choice: 3}[at no time in particular/in the morning (JST)/in the afternoon (JST)/in the evening (JST)/at night (JST)/in the wee hours of the morning (JST)].

Most active: ${choice: 2}[Every day/Weekends/Weekdays/Mondays/Tuesdays/Wednesdays/Thursdays/Fridays/Saturdays/Sundays] ${choice: 3}[at no time in particular/in the morning (PST|PDT)/in the afternoon (PST|PDT)/in the evening (PST|PDT)/at night (PST|PDT)/in the wee hours of the morning (PST|PDT)].

Most active: ${choice: 2}[Every day/Weekends/Weekdays/Mondays/Tuesdays/Wednesdays/Thursdays/Fridays/Saturdays/Sundays] ${choice: 3}[at no time in particular/in the morning (GMT)/in the afternoon (GMT)/in the evening (GMT)/at night (GMT)/in the wee hours of the morning (GMT)].
Please review the content of your linkshell. I will start looking for new members once you have confirmed that everything is in order.${prompt}
I can start looking for new members immediately. Is this information correct?${prompt}
May your journeys lead you to many as-yet-unmet friends, and may the bonds you forge last a lifetime.${prompt}
Another member of that linkshell currently has an active registration. Please wait until that registration expires and try again.${prompt}
A manual describing proper chat manners floats in front of you.${prompt}
I don't know what to talk about.
How can I get people to like me?
What happens if we don't mesh?${prompt}
Perhaps consider starting with a simple greeting. Something like...${prompt}
“Hello, everyone. My name's ${name-player}. Nice to meet you!”${prompt}
Of course, injecting your own personal flavor may act as a conversation starter and help people to remember you.${prompt}
No matter which route you choose, make sure to always remain polite. There is no better way to start a friendship off on the right foot.${prompt}
When speaking with others, it's critical to listen and be mindful of what they say.${prompt}
Always talking and never listening may come across as rude.${prompt}
Another important point is to always be mindful of the listener. How would you feel if someone said that to you? Think carefully before sending someone a message.${prompt}
It also helps to be clear and concise.${prompt}
Being vague might cause others to get the wrong impression.${prompt}
Be extremely careful when giving out personal information such as your address or telephone number.${prompt}
Furthermore, refrain from making disparaging or aggressive remarks.${prompt}
Once you are close to someone, you may be more comfortable letting your hair down, but it is strongly recommended that you refrain from any actions that may be construed as harassment.${prompt}
After joining a linkshell, you may find that you have difficulty participating in conversation or that your personality is too different from the other members.${prompt}
One of your options in such a situation is to inform the linkshell leader and then leave.${prompt}
Finding a linkshell that is the perfect fit might not always be easy, but there is certainly a group out there that will match your feelings and goals.${prompt}
Once you find those kinds of friends, hold them fast and value them as much as they value you. There is no better way to enjoy life in Vana'diel.${prompt}
The linkshell concierge opens up a tiny notebook...
I think he wants to talk to you about something.${prompt}
He probably has grown tired of Bastok and wants to ask you about life outside these walls.${prompt}
Although, don't take him outside the city, no matter how much he begs you.
Sometimes, he gets this blank look on his face and says he's forgetting something important.${prompt}
So that's why I'm always trying to keep an eye on him.${prompt}
Although, whenever I do, I often feel waves of nostalgia crashing over me too.${prompt}
Hmm... Maybe Raebrimm is actually somebody I knew before that has undergone some kind of rebirth...${prompt}
Oh, where was I? Ah, yes...
If you're going to see Raebrimm, you should probably hurry.${prompt}
You should be able to catch up with him at the entrance to the Zeruhn Mines just west of here.${prompt}
Apparently, he was sent on an errand, so he said he needed to visit Drangord.${prompt}
Hey, ${choice: 6}[miss/mister]. I think Raebrimm wants to talk to you.
I guess he's on some kind of errand, so he said he was going to visit Drangord.${prompt}
You might be able to find him at the entrance to the Zeruhn Mines just west of here.${prompt}
Hm? You say you're a friend of Raebrimm's?${prompt}
I actually just sent him on another errand.${prompt}
He may be just a kid, but he's quite dependable.
Although, I probably shouldn't ask so much of him...${prompt}
I'll go get him for ya.${prompt}
It just came to me after staring at that large mountain every day!${prompt}
That “eggshell” I gave to that Gloom Phantom guy in the Korroloka Tunnel...${prompt}
I remember that it also came from a large mountain.${prompt}
I was surrounded by the sparkle of twilight...
I kept climbing the mountain path as it rose higher and higher...
And once I reached the summit, I saw somebody there!
Sorry, it's still a bit fuzzy...${prompt}
I just thought it was important to tell somebody about this right away.${prompt}
I thought you might know what it meant, ${name-player}.${prompt}
Why are you so out of breath!?${prompt}
Some terrifying monsters have appeared within the Zeruhn Mines!${prompt}
We have to help the people still trapped in the mines!${prompt}
At times like this, it's important to remain calm.
That allows us to protect what's important.${prompt}
Hm? You saw Cornelia, and there's trouble in the Zeruhn Mines?${prompt}
I'm sure the Mythril Musketeers will show up any moment now, so there's nothing to worry about.
Although, I suppose it's too early to let down our guard.${prompt}
Can you hurry over to the mines, ${choice: 6}[miss/mister]?
This sudden attack by the Quadav...
What will become of Bastok, and of us?${prompt}
Here you can play the game Mandragora Mania.
${color-alt: 123}That option is currently unavailable. You will be able to select it again in ${number: 5} day${choice-plurality: 5}[/s] (Earth time).
You may pay ${number: 38} gil to reset all rewards, enabling you to purchase them again.

The reward exchange period has turned over and all rewards have been reset.
You may reset all rewards from the appropriate dialogue box.
${color-alt: 151}Starting pattern set to ${choice: 8}[Random/Pattern A/Pattern B/Pattern C/Pattern D/Pattern E].
Mandragora Mania is a game in which you battle for jingly by moving your mandragora pieces to the goal.${prompt}
Your goal is the ${choice: 0}[red/blue/green] one on the right, while your opponent's is the ${choice: 0}[blue/green/red] one on the left.${prompt}
At the start of the game, three mandragoras each will be placed on the eight game areas, excluding the goal.${prompt}
There are five starting placements (A through E), and you are able to select which one you would like to employ. The default setting is "Random."${prompt}
This explanation uses pattern A, but the basic rules are the same regardless of the starting pattern.${prompt}

The three ${choice: 0}[red/blue/green] areas in front of you are yours,${wait-36: 2}the three ${choice: 0}[blue/green/red] areas at the back are your opponent's,${wait-36: 2}and the remaining two are neutral.${prompt}
You must choose one area--either yours or a neutral one--to proceed.${prompt}
The areas are numbered from one to five starting from the left, and any mandragoras in the area you select will move.${prompt}
Conversely, your opponent must select either a neutral area or an area that belongs to them.${prompt}
From the right, those areas are numbered 6, 4, 7, 2, and 8.${prompt}
For example, if you select Area 1,${wait-36: 4}one mandragora will move to Area 2${wait-36: 1}and one will move to Area 3,${wait-36: 1}and one will move to Area 4.${prompt}
Note that the mandragoras will move from the back first--last in, first out.${prompt}
You will receive points known as “jingly” each time one of your mandragoras reaches the goal.${prompt}
You will enter your opponent's territory whenever you go past the goal.${prompt}

If one of your mandragoras happens to reach the opponent's goal, the goal will be pushed back and your mandragora will return to your own area. You don't have to worry about your mandragora earning any jingly for your opponent.${prompt}
The order in which players choose areas will be determined based on your turn settings. The default setting is random.${prompt}
This explanation has skipped past your opponent's turn for demonstration purposes, but in the actual game you and your opponent will take turns choosing areas.${prompt}
However, if the last mandragora to move reaches the goal, you will get to take an additional turn.${prompt}
Mandragoras are a very diverse species, and the amount of jingly you earn is determined by the species of mandragora that crosses into the goal.${prompt}
